line_text: Old John of Gaunt, time-honour'd Lancaster,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Hast thou, according to thy oath and band,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Brought hither Henry Hereford thy bold son,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Here to make good the boisterous late appeal,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Which then our leisure would not let us hear,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Against the Duke of Norfolk, Thomas Mowbray?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: I have, my liege.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Tell me, moreover, hast thou sounded him,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: If he appeal the duke on ancient malice;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Or worthily, as a good subject should,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: On some known ground of treachery in him?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: As near as I could sift him on that argument,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: On some apparent danger seen in him
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Aim'd at your highness, no inveterate malice.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Then call them to our presence; face to face,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: And frowning brow to brow, ourselves will hear
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: The accuser and the accused freely speak:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: High-stomach'd are they both, and full of ire,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: In rage deaf as the sea, hasty as fire.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Many years of happy days befal
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: My gracious sovereign, my most loving liege!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Each day still better other's happiness;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Until the heavens, envying earth's good hap,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Add an immortal title to your crown!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: We thank you both: yet one but flatters us,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: As well appeareth by the cause you come;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Namely to appeal each other of high treason.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Cousin of Hereford, what dost thou object
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Against the Duke of Norfolk, Thomas Mowbray?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: First, heaven be the record to my speech!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: In the devotion of a subject's love,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Tendering the precious safety of my prince,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: And free from other misbegotten hate,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Come I appellant to this princely presence.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Now, Thomas Mowbray, do I turn to thee,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: And mark my greeting well; for what I speak
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: My body shall make good upon this earth,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Or my divine soul answer it in heaven.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Thou art a traitor and a miscreant,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Too good to be so and too bad to live,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Since the more fair and crystal is the sky,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: The uglier seem the clouds that in it fly.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Once more, the more to aggravate the note,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: With a foul traitor's name stuff I thy throat;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: And wish, so please my sovereign, ere I move,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: What my tongue speaks my right drawn sword may prove.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Let not my cold words here accuse my zeal:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: 'Tis not the trial of a woman's war,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: The bitter clamour of two eager tongues,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Can arbitrate this cause betwixt us twain;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: The blood is hot that must be cool'd for this:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Yet can I not of such tame patience boast
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: As to be hush'd and nought at all to say:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: First, the fair reverence of your highness curbs me
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: From giving reins and spurs to my free speech;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Which else would post until it had return'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: These terms of treason doubled down his throat.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Setting aside his high blood's royalty,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: And let him be no kinsman to my liege,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: I do defy him, and I spit at him;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Call him a slanderous coward and a villain:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Which to maintain I would allow him odds,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: And meet him, were I tied to run afoot
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Even to the frozen ridges of the Alps,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Or any other ground inhabitable,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Where ever Englishman durst set his foot.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Mean time let this defend my loyalty,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: By all my hopes, most falsely doth he lie.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Pale trembling coward, there I throw my gage,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Disclaiming here the kindred of the king,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: And lay aside my high blood's royalty,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Which fear, not reverence, makes thee to except.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: If guilty dread have left thee so much strength
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: As to take up mine honour's pawn, then stoop:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: By that and all the rites of knighthood else,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Will I make good against thee, arm to arm,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: What I have spoke, or thou canst worse devise.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: I take it up; and by that sword I swear
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Which gently laid my knighthood on my shoulder,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: I'll answer thee in any fair degree,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Or chivalrous design of knightly trial:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: And when I mount, alive may I not light,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: If I be traitor or unjustly fight!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: What doth our cousin lay to Mowbray's charge?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: It must be great that can inherit us
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: So much as of a thought of ill in him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Look, what I speak, my life shall prove it true;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: That Mowbray hath received eight thousand nobles
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: In name of lendings for your highness' soldiers,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: The which he hath detain'd for lewd employments,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Like a false traitor and injurious villain.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Besides I say and will in battle prove,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Or here or elsewhere to the furthest verge
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: That ever was survey'd by English eye,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: That all the treasons for these eighteen years
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Complotted and contrived in this land
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Fetch from false Mowbray their first head and spring.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Further I say and further will maintain
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Upon his bad life to make all this good,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: That he did plot the Duke of Gloucester's death,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Suggest his soon-believing adversaries,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: And consequently, like a traitor coward,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Sluiced out his innocent soul through streams of blood:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Which blood, like sacrificing Abel's, cries,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Even from the tongueless caverns of the earth,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: To me for justice and rough chastisement;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: And, by the glorious worth of my descent,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: This arm shall do it, or this life be spent.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: How high a pitch his resolution soars!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Thomas of Norfolk, what say'st thou to this?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: O, let my sovereign turn away his face
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: And bid his ears a little while be deaf,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Till I have told this slander of his blood,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: How God and good men hate so foul a liar.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Mowbray, impartial are our eyes and ears:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Were he my brother, nay, my kingdom's heir,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: As he is but my father's brother's son,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Now, by my sceptre's awe, I make a vow,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Such neighbour nearness to our sacred blood
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Should nothing privilege him, nor partialize
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: The unstooping firmness of my upright soul:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: He is our subject, Mowbray; so art thou:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Free speech and fearless I to thee allow.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Then, Bolingbroke, as low as to thy heart,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Through the false passage of thy throat, thou liest.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Three parts of that receipt I had for Calais
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Disbursed I duly to his highness' soldiers;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: The other part reserved I by consent,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: For that my sovereign liege was in my debt
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Upon remainder of a dear account,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Since last I went to France to fetch his queen:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Now swallow down that lie. For Gloucester's death,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: I slew him not; but to my own disgrace
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Neglected my sworn duty in that case.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: For you, my noble Lord of Lancaster,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: The honourable father to my foe
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Once did I lay an ambush for your life,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: A trespass that doth vex my grieved soul
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: But ere I last received the sacrament
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: I did confess it, and exactly begg'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Your grace's pardon, and I hope I had it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: This is my fault: as for the rest appeall'd,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: It issues from the rancour of a villain,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: A recreant and most degenerate traitor
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Which in myself I boldly will defend;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: And interchangeably hurl down my gage
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Upon this overweening traitor's foot,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: To prove myself a loyal gentleman
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Even in the best blood chamber'd in his bosom.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: In haste whereof, most heartily I pray
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Your highness to assign our trial day.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Wrath-kindled gentlemen, be ruled by me;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Let's purge this choler without letting blood:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: This we prescribe, though no physician;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Deep malice makes too deep incision;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Forget, forgive; conclude and be agreed;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Our doctors say this is no month to bleed.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Good uncle, let this end where it begun;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: We'll calm the Duke of Norfolk, you your son.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: To be a make-peace shall become my age:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Throw down, my son, the Duke of Norfolk's gage.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: And, Norfolk, throw down his.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: When, Harry, when?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Obedience bids I should not bid again.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Norfolk, throw down, we bid; there is no boot.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Myself I throw, dread sovereign, at thy foot.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: My life thou shalt command, but not my shame:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: The one my duty owes; but my fair name,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Despite of death that lives upon my grave,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: To dark dishonour's use thou shalt not have.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: I am disgraced, impeach'd and baffled here,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Pierced to the soul with slander's venom'd spear,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: The which no balm can cure but his heart-blood
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Which breathed this poison.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Rage must be withstood:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Give me his gage: lions make leopards tame.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Yea, but not change his spots: take but my shame.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: And I resign my gage. My dear dear lord,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: The purest treasure mortal times afford
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Is spotless reputation: that away,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Men are but gilded loam or painted clay.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: A jewel in a ten-times-barr'd-up chest
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Is a bold spirit in a loyal breast.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Mine honour is my life; both grow in one:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Take honour from me, and my life is done:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Then, dear my liege, mine honour let me try;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: In that I live and for that will I die.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Cousin, throw up your gage; do you begin.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: O, God defend my soul from such deep sin!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Shall I seem crest-fall'n in my father's sight?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Or with pale beggar-fear impeach my height
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Before this out-dared dastard? Ere my tongue
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Shall wound my honour with such feeble wrong,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Or sound so base a parle, my teeth shall tear
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: The slavish motive of recanting fear,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: And spit it bleeding in his high disgrace,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Where shame doth harbour, even in Mowbray's face.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: We were not born to sue, but to command;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Which since we cannot do to make you friends,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Be ready, as your lives shall answer it,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: At Coventry, upon Saint Lambert's day:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: There shall your swords and lances arbitrate
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: The swelling difference of your settled hate:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Since we can not atone you, we shall see
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Justice design the victor's chivalry.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Lord marshal, command our officers at arms
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Be ready to direct these home alarms.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. KING RICHARD II's palace.

line_text: Alas, the part I had in Woodstock's blood
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Doth more solicit me than your exclaims,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: To stir against the butchers of his life!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: But since correction lieth in those hands
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Which made the fault that we cannot correct,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Put we our quarrel to the will of heaven;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Who, when they see the hours ripe on earth,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Will rain hot vengeance on offenders' heads.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Finds brotherhood in thee no sharper spur?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Hath love in thy old blood no living fire?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Edward's seven sons, whereof thyself art one,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Were as seven vials of his sacred blood,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Or seven fair branches springing from one root:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Some of those seven are dried by nature's course,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Some of those branches by the Destinies cut;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: But Thomas, my dear lord, my life, my Gloucester,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: One vial full of Edward's sacred blood,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: One flourishing branch of his most royal root,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Is crack'd, and all the precious liquor spilt,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Is hack'd down, and his summer leaves all faded,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: By envy's hand and murder's bloody axe.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Ah, Gaunt, his blood was thine! that bed, that womb,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: That metal, that self-mould, that fashion'd thee
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Made him a man; and though thou livest and breathest,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Yet art thou slain in him: thou dost consent
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: In some large measure to thy father's death,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: In that thou seest thy wretched brother die,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Who was the model of thy father's life.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Call it not patience, Gaunt; it is despair:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: In suffering thus thy brother to be slaughter'd,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Thou showest the naked pathway to thy life,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Teaching stern murder how to butcher thee:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: That which in mean men we intitle patience
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Is pale cold cowardice in noble breasts.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: What shall I say? to safeguard thine own life,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: The best way is to venge my Gloucester's death.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: God's is the quarrel; for God's substitute,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: His deputy anointed in His sight,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Hath caused his death: the which if wrongfully,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Let heaven revenge; for I may never lift
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: An angry arm against His minister.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Where then, alas, may I complain myself?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: To God, the widow's champion and defence.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Why, then, I will. Farewell, old Gaunt.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Thou goest to Coventry, there to behold
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Our cousin Hereford and fell Mowbray fight:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: O, sit my husband's wrongs on Hereford's spear,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: That it may enter butcher Mowbray's breast!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Or, if misfortune miss the first career,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Be Mowbray's sins so heavy in his bosom,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: They may break his foaming courser's back,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: And throw the rider headlong in the lists,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: A caitiff recreant to my cousin Hereford!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Farewell, old Gaunt: thy sometimes brother's wife
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: With her companion grief must end her life.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Sister, farewell; I must to Coventry:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: As much good stay with thee as go with me!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Yet one word more: grief boundeth where it falls,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Not with the empty hollowness, but weight:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: I take my leave before I have begun,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: For sorrow ends not when it seemeth done.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Commend me to thy brother, Edmund York.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Lo, this is all:--nay, yet depart not so;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Though this be all, do not so quickly go;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: I shall remember more. Bid him--ah, what?--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: With all good speed at Plashy visit me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Alack, and what shall good old York there see
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: But empty lodgings and unfurnish'd walls,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Unpeopled offices, untrodden stones?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: And what hear there for welcome but my groans?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Therefore commend me; let him not come there,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: To seek out sorrow that dwells every where.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: Desolate, desolate, will I hence and die:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: The last leave of thee takes my weeping eye.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF LANCASTER'S palace.

line_text: My Lord Aumerle, is Harry Hereford arm'd?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Yea, at all points; and longs to enter in.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: The Duke of Norfolk, sprightfully and bold,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Stays but the summons of the appellant's trumpet.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Why, then, the champions are prepared, and stay
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: For nothing but his majesty's approach.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Marshal, demand of yonder champion
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: The cause of his arrival here in arms:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Ask him his name and orderly proceed
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: To swear him in the justice of his cause.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: In God's name and the king's, say who thou art
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And why thou comest thus knightly clad in arms,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Against what man thou comest, and what thy quarrel:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Speak truly, on thy knighthood and thy oath;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: As so defend thee heaven and thy valour!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: My name is Thomas Mowbray, Duke of Norfolk;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Who hither come engaged by my oath--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Which God defend a knight should violate!--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Both to defend my loyalty and truth
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: To God, my king and my succeeding issue,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Against the Duke of Hereford that appeals me
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And, by the grace of God and this mine arm,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: To prove him, in defending of myself,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: A traitor to my God, my king, and me:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And as I truly fight, defend me heaven!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Marshal, ask yonder knight in arms,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Both who he is and why he cometh hither
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Thus plated in habiliments of war,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And formally, according to our law,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Depose him in the justice of his cause.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: What is thy name? and wherefore comest thou hither,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Before King Richard in his royal lists?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Against whom comest thou? and what's thy quarrel?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Speak like a true knight, so defend thee heaven!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Harry of Hereford, Lancaster and Derby
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Am I; who ready here do stand in arms,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: To prove, by God's grace and my body's valour,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: In lists, on Thomas Mowbray, Duke of Norfolk,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: That he is a traitor, foul and dangerous,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: To God of heaven, King Richard and to me;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And as I truly fight, defend me heaven!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: On pain of death, no person be so bold
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Or daring-hardy as to touch the lists,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Except the marshal and such officers
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Appointed to direct these fair designs.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Lord marshal, let me kiss my sovereign's hand,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And bow my knee before his majesty:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: For Mowbray and myself are like two men
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: That vow a long and weary pilgrimage;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Then let us take a ceremonious leave
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And loving farewell of our several friends.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: The appellant in all duty greets your highness,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And craves to kiss your hand and take his leave.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: We will descend and fold him in our arms.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Cousin of Hereford, as thy cause is right,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: So be thy fortune in this royal fight!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Farewell, my blood; which if to-day thou shed,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Lament we may, but not revenge thee dead.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: O let no noble eye profane a tear
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: For me, if I be gored with Mowbray's spear:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: As confident as is the falcon's flight
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Against a bird, do I with Mowbray fight.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: My loving lord, I take my leave of you;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Of you, my noble cousin, Lord Aumerle;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Not sick, although I have to do with death,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: But lusty, young, and cheerly drawing breath.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Lo, as at English feasts, so I regreet
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: The daintiest last, to make the end most sweet:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: O thou, the earthly author of my blood,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Whose youthful spirit, in me regenerate,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Doth with a twofold vigour lift me up
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: To reach at victory above my head,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Add proof unto mine armour with thy prayers;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And with thy blessings steel my lance's point,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: That it may enter Mowbray's waxen coat,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And furbish new the name of John a Gaunt,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Even in the lusty havior of his son.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: God in thy good cause make thee prosperous!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Be swift like lightning in the execution;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And let thy blows, doubly redoubled,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Fall like amazing thunder on the casque
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Of thy adverse pernicious enemy:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Rouse up thy youthful blood, be valiant and live.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Mine innocency and Saint George to thrive!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: However God or fortune cast my lot,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: There lives or dies, true to King Richard's throne,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: A loyal, just and upright gentleman:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Never did captive with a freer heart
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Cast off his chains of bondage and embrace
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: His golden uncontroll'd enfranchisement,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: More than my dancing soul doth celebrate
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: This feast of battle with mine adversary.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Most mighty liege, and my companion peers,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Take from my mouth the wish of happy years:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: As gentle and as jocund as to jest
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Go I to fight: truth hath a quiet breast.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Receive thy lance; and God defend the right!

scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: On pain to be found false and recreant,

scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: A traitor to his God, his king and him;

line_text: And dares him to set forward to the fight.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Here standeth Thomas Mowbray, Duke of Norfolk,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: On pain to be found false and recreant,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Both to defend himself and to approve
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Henry of Hereford, Lancaster, and Derby,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: To God, his sovereign and to him disloyal;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Courageously and with a free desire
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Let them lay by their helmets and their spears,

scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And both return back to their chairs again:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Withdraw with us: and let the trumpets sound
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: While we return these dukes what we decree.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Draw near,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And list what with our council we have done.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: For that our kingdom's earth should not be soil'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: With that dear blood which it hath fostered;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And for our eyes do hate the dire aspect
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Of civil wounds plough'd up with neighbours' sword;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And for we think the eagle-winged pride
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Of sky-aspiring and ambitious thoughts,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: With rival-hating envy, set on you
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: To wake our peace, which in our country's cradle
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Draws the sweet infant breath of gentle sleep;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Which so roused up with boisterous untuned drums,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: With harsh resounding trumpets' dreadful bray,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And grating shock of wrathful iron arms,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Might from our quiet confines fright fair peace
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And make us wade even in our kindred's blood,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Therefore, we banish you our territories:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: You, cousin Hereford, upon pain of life,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Till twice five summers have enrich'd our fields
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Shall not regreet our fair dominions,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: But tread the stranger paths of banishment.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Your will be done: this must my comfort be,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Sun that warms you here shall shine on me;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And those his golden beams to you here lent
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Shall point on me and gild my banishment.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Norfolk, for thee remains a heavier doom,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Which I with some unwillingness pronounce:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: The sly slow hours shall not determinate
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: The dateless limit of thy dear exile;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: The hopeless word of 'never to return'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Breathe I against thee, upon pain of life.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: A heavy sentence, my most sovereign liege,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And all unlook'd for from your highness' mouth:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: A dearer merit, not so deep a maim
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: As to be cast forth in the common air,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Have I deserved at your highness' hands.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: The language I have learn'd these forty years,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: My native English, now I must forego:

scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And now my tongue's use is to me no more
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Than an unstringed viol or a harp,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Or like a cunning instrument cased up,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Or, being open, put into his hands
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: That knows no touch to tune the harmony:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Within my mouth you have engaol'd my tongue,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Doubly portcullis'd with my teeth and lips;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: And dull unfeeling barren ignorance
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Is made my gaoler to attend on me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: I am too old to fawn upon a nurse,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Too far in years to be a pupil now:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: What is thy sentence then but speechless death,

scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: Which robs my tongue from breathing native breath?

scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: It boots thee not to be compassionate:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

line_text: After our sentence plaining comes too late.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  The lists at Coventry.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: As 'twere to banish their affects with him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: Off goes his bonnet to an oyster-wench;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: A brace of draymen bid God speed him well
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: And had the tribute of his supple knee,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: With 'Thanks, my countrymen, my loving friends;'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: As were our England in reversion his,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: And he our subjects' next degree in hope.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: Well, he is gone; and with him go these thoughts.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: Now for the rebels which stand out in Ireland,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: Expedient manage must be made, my liege,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: Ere further leisure yield them further means
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: For their advantage and your highness' loss.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: We will ourself in person to this war:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: And, for our coffers, with too great a court
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: And liberal largess, are grown somewhat light,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: We are inforced to farm our royal realm;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: The revenue whereof shall furnish us
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: For our affairs in hand: if that come short,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: Our substitutes at home shall have blank charters;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: Whereto, when they shall know what men are rich,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: They shall subscribe them for large sums of gold
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: And send them after to supply our wants;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: For we will make for Ireland presently.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: Bushy, what news?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: Old John of Gaunt is grievous sick, my lord,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: Suddenly taken; and hath sent post haste
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: To entreat your majesty to visit him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: Where lies he?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: At Ely House.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: Now put it, God, in the physician's mind
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: To help him to his grave immediately!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: The lining of his coffers shall make coats
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: To deck our soldiers for these Irish wars.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: Come, gentlemen, let's all go visit him:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: Pray God we may make haste, and come too late!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: Amen.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The court.

line_text: Will the king come, that I may breathe my last
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: In wholesome counsel to his unstaid youth?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Vex not yourself, nor strive not with your breath;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: For all in vain comes counsel to his ear.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: O, but they say the tongues of dying men
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Enforce attention like deep harmony:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Where words are scarce, they are seldom spent in vain,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: For they breathe truth that breathe their words in pain.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: He that no more must say is listen'd more
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Than they whom youth and ease have taught to glose;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: More are men's ends mark'd than their lives before:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: The setting sun, and music at the close,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: As the last taste of sweets, is sweetest last,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Writ in remembrance more than things long past:
