play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Though Richard my life's counsel would not hear,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: My death's sad tale may yet undeaf his ear.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: No; it is stopp'd with other flattering sounds,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: As praises, of whose taste the wise are fond,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Lascivious metres, to whose venom sound
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: The open ear of youth doth always listen;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Report of fashions in proud Italy,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Whose manners still our tardy apish nation
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Limps after in base imitation.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Where doth the world thrust forth a vanity--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: So it be new, there's no respect how vile--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: That is not quickly buzzed into his ears?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Then all too late comes counsel to be heard,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Where will doth mutiny with wit's regard.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Direct not him whose way himself will choose:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: 'Tis breath thou lack'st, and that breath wilt thou lose.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Methinks I am a prophet new inspired
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: And thus expiring do foretell of him:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: His rash fierce blaze of riot cannot last,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: For violent fires soon burn out themselves;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Small showers last long, but sudden storms are short;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: He tires betimes that spurs too fast betimes;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: With eager feeding food doth choke the feeder:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Light vanity, insatiate cormorant,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Consuming means, soon preys upon itself.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: This royal throne of kings, this scepter'd isle,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: This earth of majesty, this seat of Mars,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: This other Eden, demi-paradise,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: This fortress built by Nature for herself
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Against infection and the hand of war,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: This happy breed of men, this little world,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: This precious stone set in the silver sea,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Which serves it in the office of a wall,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Or as a moat defensive to a house,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Against the envy of less happier lands,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: This blessed plot, this earth, this realm, this England,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: This nurse, this teeming womb of royal kings,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Fear'd by their breed and famous by their birth,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Renowned for their deeds as far from home,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: For Christian service and true chivalry,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: As is the sepulchre in stubborn Jewry,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Of the world's ransom, blessed Mary's Son,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: This land of such dear souls, this dear dear land,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Dear for her reputation through the world,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Is now leased out, I die pronouncing it,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Like to a tenement or pelting farm:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: England, bound in with the triumphant sea
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Whose rocky shore beats back the envious siege
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Of watery Neptune, is now bound in with shame,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: With inky blots and rotten parchment bonds:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: That England, that was wont to conquer others,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Hath made a shameful conquest of itself.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Ah, would the scandal vanish with my life,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: How happy then were my ensuing death!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: The king is come: deal mildly with his youth;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: For young hot colts being raged do rage the more.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: How fares our noble uncle, Lancaster?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: What comfort, man? how is't with aged Gaunt?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: O how that name befits my composition!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Old Gaunt indeed, and gaunt in being old:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Within me grief hath kept a tedious fast;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: And who abstains from meat that is not gaunt?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: For sleeping England long time have I watch'd;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Watching breeds leanness, leanness is all gaunt:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: The pleasure that some fathers feed upon,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Is my strict fast; I mean, my children's looks;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: And therein fasting, hast thou made me gaunt:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Gaunt am I for the grave, gaunt as a grave,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Whose hollow womb inherits nought but bones.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Can sick men play so nicely with their names?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: No, misery makes sport to mock itself:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Since thou dost seek to kill my name in me,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: I mock my name, great king, to flatter thee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Should dying men flatter with those that live?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: No, no, men living flatter those that die.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Thou, now a-dying, say'st thou flatterest me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: O, no! thou diest, though I the sicker be.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: I am in health, I breathe, and see thee ill.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Now He that made me knows I see thee ill;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Ill in myself to see, and in thee seeing ill.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Thy death-bed is no lesser than thy land
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Wherein thou liest in reputation sick;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: And thou, too careless patient as thou art,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Commit'st thy anointed body to the cure
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Of those physicians that first wounded thee:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: A thousand flatterers sit within thy crown,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Whose compass is no bigger than thy head;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: And yet, incaged in so small a verge,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: The waste is no whit lesser than thy land.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: O, had thy grandsire with a prophet's eye
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Seen how his son's son should destroy his sons,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: From forth thy reach he would have laid thy shame,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Deposing thee before thou wert possess'd,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Which art possess'd now to depose thyself.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Why, cousin, wert thou regent of the world,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: It were a shame to let this land by lease;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: But for thy world enjoying but this land,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Is it not more than shame to shame it so?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Landlord of England art thou now, not king:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Thy state of law is bondslave to the law; And thou--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: A lunatic lean-witted fool,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Presuming on an ague's privilege,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Darest with thy frozen admonition
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Make pale our cheek, chasing the royal blood
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: With fury from his native residence.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Now, by my seat's right royal majesty,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Wert thou not brother to great Edward's son,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: This tongue that runs so roundly in thy head
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Should run thy head from thy unreverent shoulders.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: O, spare me not, my brother Edward's son,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: For that I was his father Edward's son;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: That blood already, like the pelican,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Hast thou tapp'd out and drunkenly caroused:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: My brother Gloucester, plain well-meaning soul,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Whom fair befal in heaven 'mongst happy souls!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: May be a precedent and witness good
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: That thou respect'st not spilling Edward's blood:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Join with the present sickness that I have;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: And thy unkindness be like crooked age,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: To crop at once a too long wither'd flower.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Live in thy shame, but die not shame with thee!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: These words hereafter thy tormentors be!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Convey me to my bed, then to my grave:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Love they to live that love and honour have.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: And let them die that age and sullens have;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: For both hast thou, and both become the grave.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: I do beseech your majesty, impute his words
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: To wayward sickliness and age in him:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: He loves you, on my life, and holds you dear
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: As Harry Duke of Hereford, were he here.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Right, you say true: as Hereford's love, so his;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: As theirs, so mine; and all be as it is.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: My liege, old Gaunt commends him to your majesty.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: What says he?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Nay, nothing; all is said
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: His tongue is now a stringless instrument;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Words, life and all, old Lancaster hath spent.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Be York the next that must be bankrupt so!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Though death be poor, it ends a mortal woe.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: The ripest fruit first falls, and so doth he;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: His time is spent, our pilgrimage must be.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: So much for that. Now for our Irish wars:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: We must supplant those rough rug-headed kerns,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Which live like venom where no venom else
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: But only they have privilege to live.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: And for these great affairs do ask some charge,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Towards our assistance we do seize to us
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: The plate, corn, revenues and moveables,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Whereof our uncle Gaunt did stand possess'd.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: How long shall I be patient? ah, how long
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Shall tender duty make me suffer wrong?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Not Gloucester's death, nor Hereford's banishment
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Not Gaunt's rebukes, nor England's private wrongs,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Nor the prevention of poor Bolingbroke
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: About his marriage, nor my own disgrace,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Have ever made me sour my patient cheek,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Or bend one wrinkle on my sovereign's face.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: I am the last of noble Edward's sons,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Of whom thy father, Prince of Wales, was first:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: In war was never lion raged more fierce,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: In peace was never gentle lamb more mild,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Than was that young and princely gentleman.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: His face thou hast, for even so look'd he,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Accomplish'd with the number of thy hours;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: But when he frown'd, it was against the French
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: And not against his friends; his noble hand
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Did will what he did spend and spent not that
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Which his triumphant father's hand had won;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: His hands were guilty of no kindred blood,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: But bloody with the enemies of his kin.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: O Richard! York is too far gone with grief,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Or else he never would compare between.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Why, uncle, what's the matter?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: O my liege,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Pardon me, if you please; if not, I, pleased
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Not to be pardon'd, am content withal.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Seek you to seize and gripe into your hands
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: The royalties and rights of banish'd Hereford?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Is not Gaunt dead, and doth not Hereford live?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Was not Gaunt just, and is not Harry true?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Did not the one deserve to have an heir?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Is not his heir a well-deserving son?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Take Hereford's rights away, and take from Time
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: His charters and his customary rights;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Let not to-morrow then ensue to-day;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Be not thyself; for how art thou a king
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: But by fair sequence and succession?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Now, afore God--God forbid I say true!--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: If you do wrongfully seize Hereford's rights,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Call in the letters patent that he hath
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: By his attorneys-general to sue
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: His livery, and deny his offer'd homage,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: You pluck a thousand dangers on your head,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: You lose a thousand well-disposed hearts
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: And prick my tender patience, to those thoughts
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Which honour and allegiance cannot think.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Think what you will, we seize into our hands
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: His plate, his goods, his money and his lands.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: I'll not be by the while: my liege, farewell:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: What will ensue hereof, there's none can tell;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: But by bad courses may be understood
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: That their events can never fall out good.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Go, Bushy, to the Earl of Wiltshire straight:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Bid him repair to us to Ely House
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: To see this business. To-morrow next
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: We will for Ireland; and 'tis time, I trow:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: And we create, in absence of ourself,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Our uncle York lord governor of England;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: For he is just and always loved us well.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Come on, our queen: to-morrow must we part;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Be merry, for our time of stay is short
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Well, lords, the Duke of Lancaster is dead.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: And living too; for now his son is duke.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Barely in title, not in revenue.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Richly in both, if justice had her right.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: My heart is great; but it must break with silence,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Ere't be disburden'd with a liberal tongue.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Nay, speak thy mind; and let him ne'er speak more
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: That speaks thy words again to do thee harm!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Tends that thou wouldst speak to the Duke of Hereford?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: If it be so, out with it boldly, man;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Quick is mine ear to hear of good towards him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: No good at all that I can do for him;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Unless you call it good to pity him,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Bereft and gelded of his patrimony.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Now, afore God, 'tis shame such wrongs are borne
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: In him, a royal prince, and many moe
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Of noble blood in this declining land.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: The king is not himself, but basely led
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: By flatterers; and what they will inform,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Merely in hate, 'gainst any of us all,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: That will the king severely prosecute
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: 'Gainst us, our lives, our children, and our heirs.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: The commons hath he pill'd with grievous taxes,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: And quite lost their hearts: the nobles hath he fined
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: For ancient quarrels, and quite lost their hearts.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: And daily new exactions are devised,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: As blanks, benevolences, and I wot not what:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: But what, o' God's name, doth become of this?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Wars have not wasted it, for warr'd he hath not,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: But basely yielded upon compromise
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: That which his noble ancestors achieved with blows:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: More hath he spent in peace than they in wars.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: The Earl of Wiltshire hath the realm in farm.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: The king's grown bankrupt, like a broken man.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Reproach and dissolution hangeth over him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: He hath not money for these Irish wars,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: His burthenous taxations notwithstanding,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: But by the robbing of the banish'd duke.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: His noble kinsman: most degenerate king!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: But, lords, we hear this fearful tempest sing,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Yet see no shelter to avoid the storm;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: We see the wind sit sore upon our sails,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: And yet we strike not, but securely perish.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: We see the very wreck that we must suffer;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: And unavoided is the danger now,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: For suffering so the causes of our wreck.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Not so; even through the hollow eyes of death
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: I spy life peering; but I dare not say
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: How near the tidings of our comfort is.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Nay, let us share thy thoughts, as thou dost ours.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Be confident to speak, Northumberland:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: We three are but thyself; and, speaking so,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Thy words are but as thoughts; therefore, be bold.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Then thus: I have from Port le Blanc, a bay
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: In Brittany, received intelligence
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: That Harry Duke of Hereford, Rainold Lord Cobham,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: That late broke from the Duke of Exeter,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: His brother, Archbishop late of Canterbury,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Sir Thomas Erpingham, Sir John Ramston,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Sir John Norbery, Sir Robert Waterton and Francis Quoint,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: All these well furnish'd by the Duke of Bretagne
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: With eight tall ships, three thousand men of war,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Are making hither with all due expedience
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: And shortly mean to touch our northern shore:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Perhaps they had ere this, but that they stay
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: The first departing of the king for Ireland.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: If then we shall shake off our slavish yoke,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Imp out our drooping country's broken wing,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Redeem from broking pawn the blemish'd crown,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Wipe off the dust that hides our sceptre's gilt
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: And make high majesty look like itself,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Away with me in post to Ravenspurgh;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: But if you faint, as fearing to do so,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Stay and be secret, and myself will go.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: To horse, to horse! urge doubts to them that fear.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Hold out my horse, and I will first be there.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Ely House.

line_text: Madam, your majesty is too much sad:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: You promised, when you parted with the king,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: To lay aside life-harming heaviness
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: And entertain a cheerful disposition.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: To please the king I did; to please myself
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: I cannot do it; yet I know no cause
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Why I should welcome such a guest as grief,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Save bidding farewell to so sweet a guest
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: As my sweet Richard: yet again, methinks,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Some unborn sorrow, ripe in fortune's womb,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Is coming towards me, and my inward soul
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: With nothing trembles: at some thing it grieves,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: More than with parting from my lord the king.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Each substance of a grief hath twenty shadows,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Which shows like grief itself, but is not so;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: For sorrow's eye, glazed with blinding tears,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Divides one thing entire to many objects;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Like perspectives, which rightly gazed upon
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Show nothing but confusion, eyed awry
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Distinguish form: so your sweet majesty,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Looking awry upon your lord's departure,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Find shapes of grief, more than himself, to wail;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Which, look'd on as it is, is nought but shadows
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Of what it is not. Then, thrice-gracious queen,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: More than your lord's departure weep not: more's not seen;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Or if it be, 'tis with false sorrow's eye,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Which for things true weeps things imaginary.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: It may be so; but yet my inward soul
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Persuades me it is otherwise: howe'er it be,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: I cannot but be sad; so heavy sad
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: As, though on thinking on no thought I think,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Makes me with heavy nothing faint and shrink.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: 'Tis nothing but conceit, my gracious lady.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: 'Tis nothing less: conceit is still derived
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: From some forefather grief; mine is not so,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: For nothing had begot my something grief;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Or something hath the nothing that I grieve:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: 'Tis in reversion that I do possess;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: But what it is, that is not yet known; what
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: I cannot name; 'tis nameless woe, I wot.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: God save your majesty! and well met, gentlemen:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: I hope the king is not yet shipp'd for Ireland.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Why hopest thou so? 'tis better hope he is;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: For his designs crave haste, his haste good hope:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Then wherefore dost thou hope he is not shipp'd?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: That he, our hope, might have retired his power,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: And driven into despair an enemy's hope,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Who strongly hath set footing in this land:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: The banish'd Bolingbroke repeals himself,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: And with uplifted arms is safe arrived
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: At Ravenspurgh.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Now God in heaven forbid!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Ah, madam, 'tis too true: and that is worse,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: The Lord Northumberland, his son young Henry Percy,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: The Lords of Ross, Beaumond, and Willoughby,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: With all their powerful friends, are fled to him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Why have you not proclaim'd Northumberland
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: And all the rest revolted faction traitors?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: We have: whereupon the Earl of Worcester
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Hath broke his staff, resign'd his stewardship,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: And all the household servants fled with him
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: To Bolingbroke.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: So, Green, thou art the midwife to my woe,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: And Bolingbroke my sorrow's dismal heir:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Now hath my soul brought forth her prodigy,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: And I, a gasping new-deliver'd mother,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Have woe to woe, sorrow to sorrow join'd.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Despair not, madam.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Who shall hinder me?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: I will despair, and be at enmity
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: With cozening hope: he is a flatterer,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: A parasite, a keeper back of death,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Who gently would dissolve the bands of life,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Which false hope lingers in extremity.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Here comes the Duke of York.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: With signs of war about his aged neck:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: O, full of careful business are his looks!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Uncle, for God's sake, speak comfortable words.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Should I do so, I should belie my thoughts:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Comfort's in heaven; and we are on the earth,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Where nothing lives but crosses, cares and grief.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Your husband, he is gone to save far off,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Whilst others come to make him lose at home:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Here am I left to underprop his land,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Who, weak with age, cannot support myself:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Now comes the sick hour that his surfeit made;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Now shall he try his friends that flatter'd him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: My lord, your son was gone before I came.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: He was? Why, so! go all which way it will!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: The nobles they are fled, the commons they are cold,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: And will, I fear, revolt on Hereford's side.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Sirrah, get thee to Plashy, to my sister Gloucester;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Bid her send me presently a thousand pound:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Hold, take my ring.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: My lord, I had forgot to tell your lordship,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: To-day, as I came by, I called there;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: But I shall grieve you to report the rest.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: What is't, knave?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: An hour before I came, the duchess died.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: God for his mercy! what a tide of woes
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Comes rushing on this woeful land at once!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: I know not what to do: I would to God,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: So my untruth had not provoked him to it,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: The king had cut off my head with my brother's.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: What, are there no posts dispatch'd for Ireland?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: How shall we do for money for these wars?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Come, sister,--cousin, I would say--pray, pardon me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Go, fellow, get thee home, provide some carts
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: And bring away the armour that is there.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Gentlemen, will you go muster men?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: If I know how or which way to order these affairs
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Thus thrust disorderly into my hands,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Never believe me. Both are my kinsmen:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: The one is my sovereign, whom both my oath
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: And duty bids defend; the other again
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Is my kinsman, whom the king hath wrong'd,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Whom conscience and my kindred bids to right.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Well, somewhat we must do. Come, cousin, I'll
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Dispose of you.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Gentlemen, go, muster up your men,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: And meet me presently at Berkeley.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: I should to Plashy too;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: But time will not permit: all is uneven,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: And every thing is left at six and seven.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: The wind sits fair for news to go to Ireland,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: But none returns. For us to levy power
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Proportionable to the enemy
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Is all unpossible.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Besides, our nearness to the king in love
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Is near the hate of those love not the king.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: And that's the wavering commons: for their love
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Lies in their purses, and whoso empties them
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: By so much fills their hearts with deadly hate.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Wherein the king stands generally condemn'd.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: If judgement lie in them, then so do we,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Because we ever have been near the king.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Well, I will for refuge straight to Bristol castle:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: The Earl of Wiltshire is already there.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Thither will I with you; for little office
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: The hateful commons will perform for us,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Except like curs to tear us all to pieces.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Will you go along with us?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: No; I will to Ireland to his majesty.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Farewell: if heart's presages be not vain,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: We three here art that ne'er shall meet again.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: That's as York thrives to beat back Bolingbroke.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Alas, poor duke! the task he undertakes
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Is numbering sands and drinking oceans dry:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Where one on his side fights, thousands will fly.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Farewell at once, for once, for all, and ever.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: Well, we may meet again.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: I fear me, never.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The palace.

line_text: How far is it, my lord, to Berkeley now?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Believe me, noble lord,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: I am a stranger here in Gloucestershire:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: These high wild hills and rough uneven ways
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Draws out our miles, and makes them wearisome,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And yet your fair discourse hath been as sugar,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Making the hard way sweet and delectable.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: But I bethink me what a weary way
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: From Ravenspurgh to Cotswold will be found
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: In Ross and Willoughby, wanting your company,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Which, I protest, hath very much beguiled
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: The tediousness and process of my travel:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: But theirs is sweetened with the hope to have
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: The present benefit which I possess;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And hope to joy is little less in joy
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Than hope enjoy'd: by this the weary lords
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Shall make their way seem short, as mine hath done
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: By sight of what I have, your noble company.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Of much less value is my company
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Than your good words. But who comes here?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: It is my son, young Harry Percy,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Sent from my brother Worcester, whencesoever.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Harry, how fares your uncle?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: I had thought, my lord, to have learn'd his health of you.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Why, is he not with the queen?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: No, my good Lord; he hath forsook the court,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Broken his staff of office and dispersed
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: The household of the king.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: What was his reason?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: He was not so resolved when last we spake together.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Because your lordship was proclaimed traitor.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: But he, my lord, is gone to Ravenspurgh,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: To offer service to the Duke of Hereford,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And sent me over by Berkeley, to discover
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: What power the Duke of York had levied there;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Then with directions to repair to Ravenspurgh.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Have you forgot the Duke of Hereford, boy?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: No, my good lord, for that is not forgot
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Which ne'er I did remember: to my knowledge,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: I never in my life did look on him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Then learn to know him now; this is the duke.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: My gracious lord, I tender you my service,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Such as it is, being tender, raw and young:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Which elder days shall ripen and confirm
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: To more approved service and desert.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: I thank thee, gentle Percy; and be sure
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: I count myself in nothing else so happy
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: As in a soul remembering my good friends;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And, as my fortune ripens with thy love,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: It shall be still thy true love's recompense:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: My heart this covenant makes, my hand thus seals it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: How far is it to Berkeley? and what stir
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Keeps good old York there with his men of war?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: There stands the castle, by yon tuft of trees,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Mann'd with three hundred men, as I have heard;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And in it are the Lords of York, Berkeley, and Seymour;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: None else of name and noble estimate.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Here come the Lords of Ross and Willoughby,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Bloody with spurring, fiery-red with haste.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Welcome, my lords. I wot your love pursues
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: A banish'd traitor: all my treasury
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Is yet but unfelt thanks, which more enrich'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Shall be your love and labour's recompense.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Your presence makes us rich, most noble lord.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And far surmounts our labour to attain it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Evermore thanks, the exchequer of the poor;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Which, till my infant fortune comes to years,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Stands for my bounty. But who comes here?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: It is my Lord of Berkeley, as I guess.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: My Lord of Hereford, my message is to you.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: My lord, my answer is--to Lancaster;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And I am come to seek that name in England;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And I must find that title in your tongue,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Before I make reply to aught you say.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Mistake me not, my lord; 'tis not my meaning
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: To raze one title of your honour out:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: To you, my lord, I come, what lord you will,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: From the most gracious regent of this land,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: The Duke of York, to know what pricks you on
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: To take advantage of the absent time
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And fright our native peace with self-born arms.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: I shall not need transport my words by you;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Here comes his grace in person. My noble uncle!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Show me thy humble heart, and not thy knee,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Whose duty is deceiveable and false.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: My gracious uncle--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Tut, tut!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Grace me no grace, nor uncle me no uncle:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: I am no traitor's uncle; and that word 'grace.'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: In an ungracious mouth is but profane.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Why have those banish'd and forbidden legs
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Dared once to touch a dust of England's ground?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: But then more 'why?' why have they dared to march
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: So many miles upon her peaceful bosom,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Frighting her pale-faced villages with war
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And ostentation of despised arms?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Comest thou because the anointed king is hence?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Why, foolish boy, the king is left behind,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And in my loyal bosom lies his power.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Were I but now the lord of such hot youth
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: As when brave Gaunt, thy father, and myself
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
