scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Rescued the Black Prince, that young Mars of men,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: From forth the ranks of many thousand French,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: O, then how quickly should this arm of mine.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Now prisoner to the palsy, chastise thee
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And minister correction to thy fault!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: My gracious uncle, let me know my fault:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: On what condition stands it and wherein?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Even in condition of the worst degree,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: In gross rebellion and detested treason:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Thou art a banish'd man, and here art come
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Before the expiration of thy time,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: In braving arms against thy sovereign.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: As I was banish'd, I was banish'd Hereford;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: But as I come, I come for Lancaster.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And, noble uncle, I beseech your grace
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Look on my wrongs with an indifferent eye:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: You are my father, for methinks in you
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: I see old Gaunt alive; O, then, my father,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Will you permit that I shall stand condemn'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: A wandering vagabond; my rights and royalties
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Pluck'd from my arms perforce and given away
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: To upstart unthrifts? Wherefore was I born?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: If that my cousin king be King of England,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: It must be granted I am Duke of Lancaster.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: You have a son, Aumerle, my noble cousin;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Had you first died, and he been thus trod down,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: He should have found his uncle Gaunt a father,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: To rouse his wrongs and chase them to the bay.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: I am denied to sue my livery here,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And yet my letters-patents give me leave:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: My father's goods are all distrain'd and sold,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And these and all are all amiss employ'd.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: What would you have me do? I am a subject,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And I challenge law: attorneys are denied me;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And therefore, personally I lay my claim
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: To my inheritance of free descent.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: The noble duke hath been too much abused.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: It stands your grace upon to do him right.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Base men by his endowments are made great.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: My lords of England, let me tell you this:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: I have had feeling of my cousin's wrongs
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And laboured all I could to do him right;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: But in this kind to come, in braving arms,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Be his own carver and cut out his way,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: To find out right with wrong, it may not be;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And you that do abet him in this kind
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Cherish rebellion and are rebels all.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: The noble duke hath sworn his coming is
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: But for his own; and for the right of that
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: We all have strongly sworn to give him aid;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And let him ne'er see joy that breaks that oath!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Well, well, I see the issue of these arms:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: I cannot mend it, I must needs confess,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Because my power is weak and all ill left:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: But if I could, by Him that gave me life,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: I would attach you all and make you stoop
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Unto the sovereign mercy of the king;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: But since I cannot, be it known to you
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: I do remain as neuter. So, fare you well;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Unless you please to enter in the castle
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: And there repose you for this night.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: An offer, uncle, that we will accept:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: But we must win your grace to go with us
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: To Bristol castle, which they say is held
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: By Bushy, Bagot and their complices,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: The caterpillars of the commonwealth,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Which I have sworn to weed and pluck away.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: It may be I will go with you: but yet I'll pause;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: For I am loath to break our country's laws.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Nor friends nor foes, to me welcome you are:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: Things past redress are now with me past care.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wilds in Gloucestershire.

line_text: My lord of Salisbury, we have stay'd ten days,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: And hardly kept our countrymen together,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: And yet we hear no tidings from the king;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: Therefore we will disperse ourselves: farewell.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: Stay yet another day, thou trusty Welshman:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: The king reposeth all his confidence in thee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: 'Tis thought the king is dead; we will not stay.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: The bay-trees in our country are all wither'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: And meteors fright the fixed stars of heaven;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: The pale-faced moon looks bloody on the earth
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: And lean-look'd prophets whisper fearful change;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: Rich men look sad and ruffians dance and leap,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: The one in fear to lose what they enjoy,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: The other to enjoy by rage and war:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: These signs forerun the death or fall of kings.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: Farewell: our countrymen are gone and fled,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: As well assured Richard their king is dead.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: Ah, Richard, with the eyes of heavy mind
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: I see thy glory like a shooting star
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: Fall to the base earth from the firmament.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: Thy sun sets weeping in the lowly west,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: Witnessing storms to come, woe and unrest:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: Thy friends are fled to wait upon thy foes,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: And crossly to thy good all fortune goes.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A camp in Wales.

line_text: Bring forth these men.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Bushy and Green, I will not vex your souls--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Since presently your souls must part your bodies--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: With too much urging your pernicious lives,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: For 'twere no charity; yet, to wash your blood
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: From off my hands, here in the view of men
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: I will unfold some causes of your deaths.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: You have misled a prince, a royal king,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: A happy gentleman in blood and lineaments,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: By you unhappied and disfigured clean:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: You have in manner with your sinful hours
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Made a divorce betwixt his queen and him,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Broke the possession of a royal bed
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: And stain'd the beauty of a fair queen's cheeks
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: With tears drawn from her eyes by your foul wrongs.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Myself, a prince by fortune of my birth,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Near to the king in blood, and near in love
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Till you did make him misinterpret me,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Have stoop'd my neck under your injuries,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: And sigh'd my English breath in foreign clouds,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Eating the bitter bread of banishment;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Whilst you have fed upon my signories,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Dispark'd my parks and fell'd my forest woods,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: From my own windows torn my household coat,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Razed out my imprese, leaving me no sign,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Save men's opinions and my living blood,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: To show the world I am a gentleman.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: This and much more, much more than twice all this,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Condemns you to the death. See them deliver'd over
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: To execution and the hand of death.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: More welcome is the stroke of death to me
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Than Bolingbroke to England. Lords, farewell.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: My comfort is that heaven will take our souls
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: And plague injustice with the pains of hell.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: My Lord Northumberland, see them dispatch'd.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Uncle, you say the queen is at your house;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: For God's sake, fairly let her be entreated:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Tell her I send to her my kind commends;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Take special care my greetings be deliver'd.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: A gentleman of mine I have dispatch'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: With letters of your love to her at large.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Thank, gentle uncle. Come, lords, away.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: To fight with Glendower and his complices:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Awhile to work, and after holiday.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bristol. Before the castle.

line_text: Barkloughly castle call they this at hand?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Yea, my lord. How brooks your grace the air,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: After your late tossing on the breaking seas?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Needs must I like it well: I weep for joy
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: To stand upon my kingdom once again.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Dear earth, I do salute thee with my hand,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Though rebels wound thee with their horses' hoofs:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: As a long-parted mother with her child
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Plays fondly with her tears and smiles in meeting,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: So, weeping, smiling, greet I thee, my earth,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And do thee favours with my royal hands.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Feed not thy sovereign's foe, my gentle earth,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Nor with thy sweets comfort his ravenous sense;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: But let thy spiders, that suck up thy venom,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And heavy-gaited toads lie in their way,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Doing annoyance to the treacherous feet
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Which with usurping steps do trample thee:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Yield stinging nettles to mine enemies;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And when they from thy bosom pluck a flower,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Guard it, I pray thee, with a lurking adder
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Whose double tongue may with a mortal touch
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Throw death upon thy sovereign's enemies.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Mock not my senseless conjuration, lords:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: This earth shall have a feeling and these stones
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Prove armed soldiers, ere her native king
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Shall falter under foul rebellion's arms.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Fear not, my lord: that Power that made you king
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Hath power to keep you king in spite of all.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: The means that heaven yields must be embraced,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And not neglected; else, if heaven would,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And we will not, heaven's offer we refuse,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: The proffer'd means of succor and redress.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: He means, my lord, that we are too remiss;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Whilst Bolingbroke, through our security,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Grows strong and great in substance and in power.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Discomfortable cousin! know'st thou not
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: That when the searching eye of heaven is hid,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Behind the globe, that lights the lower world,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Then thieves and robbers range abroad unseen
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: In murders and in outrage, boldly here;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: But when from under this terrestrial ball
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: He fires the proud tops of the eastern pines
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And darts his light through every guilty hole,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Then murders, treasons and detested sins,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: The cloak of night being pluck'd from off their backs,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Stand bare and naked, trembling at themselves?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: So when this thief, this traitor, Bolingbroke,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Who all this while hath revell'd in the night
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Whilst we were wandering with the antipodes,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Shall see us rising in our throne, the east,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: His treasons will sit blushing in his face,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Not able to endure the sight of day,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: But self-affrighted tremble at his sin.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Not all the water in the rough rude sea
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Can wash the balm off from an anointed king;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: The breath of worldly men cannot depose
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: The deputy elected by the Lord:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: For every man that Bolingbroke hath press'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: To lift shrewd steel against our golden crown,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: God for his Richard hath in heavenly pay
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: A glorious angel: then, if angels fight,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Weak men must fall, for heaven still guards the right.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Welcome, my lord how far off lies your power?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Nor near nor farther off, my gracious lord,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Than this weak arm: discomfort guides my tongue
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And bids me speak of nothing but despair.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: One day too late, I fear me, noble lord,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Hath clouded all thy happy days on earth:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: O, call back yesterday, bid time return,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And thou shalt have twelve thousand fighting men!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: To-day, to-day, unhappy day, too late,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: O'erthrows thy joys, friends, fortune and thy state:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: For all the Welshmen, hearing thou wert dead.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Are gone to Bolingbroke, dispersed and fled.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Comfort, my liege; why looks your grace so pale?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: But now the blood of twenty thousand men
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Did triumph in my face, and they are fled;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And, till so much blood thither come again,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Have I not reason to look pale and dead?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: All souls that will be safe fly from my side,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: For time hath set a blot upon my pride.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Comfort, my liege; remember who you are.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: I had forgot myself; am I not king?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Awake, thou coward majesty! thou sleepest.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Is not the king's name twenty thousand names?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Arm, arm, my name! a puny subject strikes
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: At thy great glory. Look not to the ground,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Ye favourites of a king: are we not high?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: High be our thoughts: I know my uncle York
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Hath power enough to serve our turn. But who comes here?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: More health and happiness betide my liege
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Than can my care-tuned tongue deliver him!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Mine ear is open and my heart prepared;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: The worst is worldly loss thou canst unfold.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Say, is my kingdom lost? why, 'twas my care
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And what loss is it to be rid of care?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Strives Bolingbroke to be as great as we?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Greater he shall not be; if he serve God,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: We'll serve Him too and be his fellow so:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Revolt our subjects? that we cannot mend;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: They break their faith to God as well as us:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Cry woe, destruction, ruin and decay:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: The worst is death, and death will have his day.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Glad am I that your highness is so arm'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: To bear the tidings of calamity.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Like an unseasonable stormy day,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Which makes the silver rivers drown their shores,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: As if the world were all dissolved to tears,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: So high above his limits swells the rage
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Of Bolingbroke, covering your fearful land
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: With hard bright steel and hearts harder than steel.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: White-beards have arm'd their thin and hairless scalps
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Against thy majesty; boys, with women's voices,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Strive to speak big and clap their female joints
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: In stiff unwieldy arms against thy crown:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: The very beadsmen learn to bend their bows
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Of double-fatal yew against thy state;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Yea, distaff-women manage rusty bills
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Against thy seat: both young and old rebel,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And all goes worse than I have power to tell.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Too well, too well thou tell'st a tale so ill.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Where is the Earl of Wiltshire? where is Bagot?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: What is become of Bushy? where is Green?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: That they have let the dangerous enemy
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Measure our confines with such peaceful steps?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: If we prevail, their heads shall pay for it:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: I warrant they have made peace with Bolingbroke.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Peace have they made with him indeed, my lord.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: O villains, vipers, damn'd without redemption!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Dogs, easily won to fawn on any man!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Snakes, in my heart-blood warm'd, that sting my heart!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Three Judases, each one thrice worse than Judas!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Would they make peace? terrible hell make war
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Upon their spotted souls for this offence!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Sweet love, I see, changing his property,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Turns to the sourest and most deadly hate:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Again uncurse their souls; their peace is made
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: With heads, and not with hands; those whom you curse
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Have felt the worst of death's destroying wound
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And lie full low, graved in the hollow ground.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Is Bushy, Green, and the Earl of Wiltshire dead?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Ay, all of them at Bristol lost their heads.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Where is the duke my father with his power?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: No matter where; of comfort no man speak:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Let's talk of graves, of worms, and epitaphs;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Make dust our paper and with rainy eyes
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Write sorrow on the bosom of the earth,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Let's choose executors and talk of wills:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And yet not so, for what can we bequeath
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Save our deposed bodies to the ground?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Our lands, our lives and all are Bolingbroke's,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And nothing can we call our own but death
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And that small model of the barren earth
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Which serves as paste and cover to our bones.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: For God's sake, let us sit upon the ground
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And tell sad stories of the death of kings;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: How some have been deposed; some slain in war,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Some haunted by the ghosts they have deposed;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Some poison'd by their wives: some sleeping kill'd;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: All murder'd: for within the hollow crown
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: That rounds the mortal temples of a king
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Keeps Death his court and there the antic sits,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Scoffing his state and grinning at his pomp,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Allowing him a breath, a little scene,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: To monarchize, be fear'd and kill with looks,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Infusing him with self and vain conceit,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: As if this flesh which walls about our life,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Were brass impregnable, and humour'd thus
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Comes at the last and with a little pin
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Bores through his castle wall, and farewell king!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Cover your heads and mock not flesh and blood
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: With solemn reverence: throw away respect,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Tradition, form and ceremonious duty,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: For you have but mistook me all this while:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: I live with bread like you, feel want,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Taste grief, need friends: subjected thus,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: How can you say to me, I am a king?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: My lord, wise men ne'er sit and wail their woes,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: But presently prevent the ways to wail.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: To fear the foe, since fear oppresseth strength,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Gives in your weakness strength unto your foe,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And so your follies fight against yourself.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Fear and be slain; no worse can come to fight:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And fight and die is death destroying death;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Where fearing dying pays death servile breath.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: My father hath a power; inquire of him
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And learn to make a body of a limb.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Thou chidest me well: proud Bolingbroke, I come
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: To change blows with thee for our day of doom.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: This ague fit of fear is over-blown;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: An easy task it is to win our own.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Say, Scroop, where lies our uncle with his power?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Speak sweetly, man, although thy looks be sour.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Men judge by the complexion of the sky
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: The state and inclination of the day:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: So may you by my dull and heavy eye,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: My tongue hath but a heavier tale to say.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: I play the torturer, by small and small
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: To lengthen out the worst that must be spoken:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Your uncle York is join'd with Bolingbroke,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And all your northern castles yielded up,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: And all your southern gentlemen in arms
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Upon his party.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Thou hast said enough.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Beshrew thee, cousin, which didst lead me forth
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Of that sweet way I was in to despair!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: What say you now? what comfort have we now?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: By heaven, I'll hate him everlastingly
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: That bids me be of comfort any more.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Go to Flint castle: there I'll pine away;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: A king, woe's slave, shall kingly woe obey.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: That power I have, discharge; and let them go
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: To ear the land that hath some hope to grow,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: For I have none: let no man speak again
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: To alter this, for counsel is but vain.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: My liege, one word.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: He does me double wrong
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: That wounds me with the flatteries of his tongue.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: Discharge my followers: let them hence away,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: From Richard's night to Bolingbroke's fair day.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The coast of Wales. A castle in view.

line_text: So that by this intelligence we learn
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: The Welshmen are dispersed, and Salisbury
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Is gone to meet the king, who lately landed
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: With some few private friends upon this coast.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: The news is very fair and good, my lord:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Richard not far from hence hath hid his head.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: It would beseem the Lord Northumberland
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: To say 'King Richard:' alack the heavy day
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: When such a sacred king should hide his head.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Your grace mistakes; only to be brief
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Left I his title out.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: The time hath been,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Would you have been so brief with him, he would
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Have been so brief with you, to shorten you,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: For taking so the head, your whole head's length.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Mistake not, uncle, further than you should.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Take not, good cousin, further than you should.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Lest you mistake the heavens are o'er our heads.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: I know it, uncle, and oppose not myself
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Against their will. But who comes here?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Welcome, Harry: what, will not this castle yield?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: The castle royally is mann'd, my lord,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Against thy entrance.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Royally!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Why, it contains no king?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Yes, my good lord,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: It doth contain a king; King Richard lies
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Within the limits of yon lime and stone:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And with him are the Lord Aumerle, Lord Salisbury,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Sir Stephen Scroop, besides a clergyman
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Of holy reverence; who, I cannot learn.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: O, belike it is the Bishop of Carlisle.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Noble lords,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Go to the rude ribs of that ancient castle;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Through brazen trumpet send the breath of parley
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Into his ruin'd ears, and thus deliver:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Henry Bolingbroke
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: On both his knees doth kiss King Richard's hand
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And sends allegiance and true faith of heart
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: To his most royal person, hither come
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Even at his feet to lay my arms and power,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Provided that my banishment repeal'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And lands restored again be freely granted:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: If not, I'll use the advantage of my power
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And lay the summer's dust with showers of blood
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Rain'd from the wounds of slaughter'd Englishmen:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: The which, how far off from the mind of Bolingbroke
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: It is, such crimson tempest should bedrench
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: The fresh green lap of fair King Richard's land,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: My stooping duty tenderly shall show.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Go, signify as much, while here we march
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Upon the grassy carpet of this plain.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Let's march without the noise of threatening drum,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: That from this castle's tatter'd battlements
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Our fair appointments may be well perused.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Methinks King Richard and myself should meet
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: With no less terror than the elements
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Of fire and water, when their thundering shock
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: At meeting tears the cloudy cheeks of heaven.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Be he the fire, I'll be the yielding water:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: The rage be his, whilst on the earth I rain
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: My waters; on the earth, and not on him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: March on, and mark King Richard how he looks.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: See, see, King Richard doth himself appear,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: As doth the blushing discontented sun
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: From out the fiery portal of the east,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: When he perceives the envious clouds are bent
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: To dim his glory and to stain the track
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Of his bright passage to the occident.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Yet looks he like a king: behold, his eye,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: As bright as is the eagle's, lightens forth
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Controlling majesty: alack, alack, for woe,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: That any harm should stain so fair a show!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: We are amazed; and thus long have we stood
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: To watch the fearful bending of thy knee,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Because we thought ourself thy lawful king:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And if we be, how dare thy joints forget
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: To pay their awful duty to our presence?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: If we be not, show us the hand of God
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: That hath dismissed us from our stewardship;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: For well we know, no hand of blood and bone
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Can gripe the sacred handle of our sceptre,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Unless he do profane, steal, or usurp.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And though you think that all, as you have done,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Have torn their souls by turning them from us,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And we are barren and bereft of friends;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Yet know, my master, God omnipotent,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Is mustering in his clouds on our behalf
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Armies of pestilence; and they shall strike
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Your children yet unborn and unbegot,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: That lift your vassal hands against my head
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And threat the glory of my precious crown.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Tell Bolingbroke--for yond methinks he stands--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: That every stride he makes upon my land
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Is dangerous treason: he is come to open
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: The purple testament of bleeding war;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: But ere the crown he looks for live in peace,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Ten thousand bloody crowns of mothers' sons
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Shall ill become the flower of England's face,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Change the complexion of her maid-pale peace
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: To scarlet indignation and bedew
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Her pastures' grass with faithful English blood.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: The king of heaven forbid our lord the king
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Should so with civil and uncivil arms
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Be rush'd upon! Thy thrice noble cousin
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Harry Bolingbroke doth humbly kiss thy hand;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And by the honourable tomb he swears,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: That stands upon your royal grandsire's bones,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And by the royalties of both your bloods,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Currents that spring from one most gracious head,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And by the buried hand of warlike Gaunt,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And by the worth and honour of himself,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Comprising all that may be sworn or said,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: His coming hither hath no further scope
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Than for his lineal royalties and to beg
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Enfranchisement immediate on his knees:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Which on thy royal party granted once,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: His glittering arms he will commend to rust,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: His barbed steeds to stables, and his heart
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: To faithful service of your majesty.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: This swears he, as he is a prince, is just;
