play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And, as I am a gentleman, I credit him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Northumberland, say thus the king returns:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: His noble cousin is right welcome hither;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And all the number of his fair demands
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Shall be accomplish'd without contradiction:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: With all the gracious utterance thou hast
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Speak to his gentle hearing kind commends.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: We do debase ourselves, cousin, do we not,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: To look so poorly and to speak so fair?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Shall we call back Northumberland, and send
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Defiance to the traitor, and so die?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: No, good my lord; let's fight with gentle words
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Till time lend friends and friends their helpful swords.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: O God, O God! that e'er this tongue of mine,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: That laid the sentence of dread banishment
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: On yon proud man, should take it off again
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: With words of sooth! O that I were as great
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: As is my grief, or lesser than my name!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Or that I could forget what I have been,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Or not remember what I must be now!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Swell'st thou, proud heart? I'll give thee scope to beat,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Since foes have scope to beat both thee and me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Northumberland comes back from Bolingbroke.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: What must the king do now? must he submit?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: The king shall do it: must he be deposed?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: The king shall be contented: must he lose
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: The name of king? o' God's name, let it go:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: I'll give my jewels for a set of beads,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: My gorgeous palace for a hermitage,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: My gay apparel for an almsman's gown,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: My figured goblets for a dish of wood,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: My sceptre for a palmer's walking staff,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: My subjects for a pair of carved saints
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And my large kingdom for a little grave,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: A little little grave, an obscure grave;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Or I'll be buried in the king's highway,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Some way of common trade, where subjects' feet
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: May hourly trample on their sovereign's head;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: For on my heart they tread now whilst I live;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And buried once, why not upon my head?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Aumerle, thou weep'st, my tender-hearted cousin!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: We'll make foul weather with despised tears;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Our sighs and they shall lodge the summer corn,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And make a dearth in this revolting land.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Or shall we play the wantons with our woes,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And make some pretty match with shedding tears?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: As thus, to drop them still upon one place,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Till they have fretted us a pair of graves
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Within the earth; and, therein laid,--there lies
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Two kinsmen digg'd their graves with weeping eyes.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Would not this ill do well? Well, well, I see
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: I talk but idly, and you laugh at me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Most mighty prince, my Lord Northumberland,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: What says King Bolingbroke? will his majesty
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Give Richard leave to live till Richard die?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: You make a leg, and Bolingbroke says ay.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: My lord, in the base court he doth attend
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: To speak with you; may it please you to come down.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Down, down I come; like glistering Phaethon,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Wanting the manage of unruly jades.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: In the base court? Base court, where kings grow base,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: To come at traitors' calls and do them grace.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: In the base court? Come down? Down, court!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: down, king!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: For night-owls shriek where mounting larks
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: should sing.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: What says his majesty?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Sorrow and grief of heart
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Makes him speak fondly, like a frantic man
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Yet he is come.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Stand all apart,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: And show fair duty to his majesty.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: My gracious lord,--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Fair cousin, you debase your princely knee
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: To make the base earth proud with kissing it:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Me rather had my heart might feel your love
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Than my unpleased eye see your courtesy.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Up, cousin, up; your heart is up, I know,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Thus high at least, although your knee be low.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: My gracious lord, I come but for mine own.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Your own is yours, and I am yours, and all.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: So far be mine, my most redoubted lord,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: As my true service shall deserve your love.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Well you deserve: they well deserve to have,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: That know the strong'st and surest way to get.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Uncle, give me your hands: nay, dry your eyes;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Tears show their love, but want their remedies.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Cousin, I am too young to be your father,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Though you are old enough to be my heir.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: What you will have, I'll give, and willing too;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: For do we must what force will have us do.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Set on towards London, cousin, is it so?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Yea, my good lord.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: Then I must not say no.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  Wales. Before Flint castle.

line_text: What sport shall we devise here in this garden,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: To drive away the heavy thought of care?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Madam, we'll play at bowls.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: 'Twill make me think the world is full of rubs,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: And that my fortune rubs against the bias.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Madam, we'll dance.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: My legs can keep no measure in delight,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: When my poor heart no measure keeps in grief:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Therefore, no dancing, girl; some other sport.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Madam, we'll tell tales.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Of sorrow or of joy?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Of either, madam.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Of neither, girl:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: For of joy, being altogether wanting,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: It doth remember me the more of sorrow;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Or if of grief, being altogether had,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: It adds more sorrow to my want of joy:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: For what I have I need not to repeat;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: And what I want it boots not to complain.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Madam, I'll sing.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: 'Tis well that thou hast cause
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: But thou shouldst please me better, wouldst thou weep.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: I could weep, madam, would it do you good.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: And I could sing, would weeping do me good,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: And never borrow any tear of thee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: But stay, here come the gardeners:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Let's step into the shadow of these trees.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: My wretchedness unto a row of pins,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: They'll talk of state; for every one doth so
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Against a change; woe is forerun with woe.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Go, bind thou up yon dangling apricocks,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Which, like unruly children, make their sire
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Stoop with oppression of their prodigal weight:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Give some supportance to the bending twigs.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Go thou, and like an executioner,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Cut off the heads of too fast growing sprays,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: That look too lofty in our commonwealth:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: All must be even in our government.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: You thus employ'd, I will go root away
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: The noisome weeds, which without profit suck
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: The soil's fertility from wholesome flowers.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Why should we in the compass of a pale
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Keep law and form and due proportion,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Showing, as in a model, our firm estate,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: When our sea-walled garden, the whole land,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Is full of weeds, her fairest flowers choked up,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Her fruit-trees all upturned, her hedges ruin'd,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Her knots disorder'd and her wholesome herbs
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Swarming with caterpillars?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Hold thy peace:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: He that hath suffer'd this disorder'd spring
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Hath now himself met with the fall of leaf:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: The weeds which his broad-spreading leaves did shelter,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: That seem'd in eating him to hold him up,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Are pluck'd up root and all by Bolingbroke,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: I mean the Earl of Wiltshire, Bushy, Green.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: What, are they dead?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: They are; and Bolingbroke
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Hath seized the wasteful king. O, what pity is it
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: That he had not so trimm'd and dress'd his land
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: As we this garden! We at time of year
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Do wound the bark, the skin of our fruit-trees,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Lest, being over-proud in sap and blood,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: With too much riches it confound itself:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Had he done so to great and growing men,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: They might have lived to bear and he to taste
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Their fruits of duty: superfluous branches
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: We lop away, that bearing boughs may live:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Had he done so, himself had borne the crown,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Which waste of idle hours hath quite thrown down.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: What, think you then the king shall be deposed?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Depress'd he is already, and deposed
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: 'Tis doubt he will be: letters came last night
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: To a dear friend of the good Duke of York's,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: That tell black tidings.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: O, I am press'd to death through want of speaking!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Thou, old Adam's likeness, set to dress this garden,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: How dares thy harsh rude tongue sound this unpleasing news?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: What Eve, what serpent, hath suggested thee
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: To make a second fall of cursed man?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Why dost thou say King Richard is deposed?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Darest thou, thou little better thing than earth,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Divine his downfall? Say, where, when, and how,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Camest thou by this ill tidings? speak, thou wretch.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Pardon me, madam: little joy have I
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: To breathe this news; yet what I say is true.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: King Richard, he is in the mighty hold
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Of Bolingbroke: their fortunes both are weigh'd:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: In your lord's scale is nothing but himself,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: And some few vanities that make him light;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: But in the balance of great Bolingbroke,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Besides himself, are all the English peers,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: And with that odds he weighs King Richard down.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Post you to London, and you will find it so;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: I speak no more than every one doth know.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Nimble mischance, that art so light of foot,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Doth not thy embassage belong to me,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: And am I last that knows it? O, thou think'st
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: To serve me last, that I may longest keep
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Thy sorrow in my breast. Come, ladies, go,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: To meet at London London's king in woe.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: What, was I born to this, that my sad look
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Should grace the triumph of great Bolingbroke?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Gardener, for telling me these news of woe,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Pray God the plants thou graft'st may never grow.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Poor queen! so that thy state might be no worse,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: I would my skill were subject to thy curse.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Here did she fall a tear; here in this place
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: I'll set a bank of rue, sour herb of grace:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Rue, even for ruth, here shortly shall be seen,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: In the remembrance of a weeping queen.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  LANGLEY. The DUKE OF YORK's garden.

line_text: Call forth Bagot.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Now, Bagot, freely speak thy mind;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: What thou dost know of noble Gloucester's death,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Who wrought it with the king, and who perform'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: The bloody office of his timeless end.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Then set before my face the Lord Aumerle.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Cousin, stand forth, and look upon that man.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: My Lord Aumerle, I know your daring tongue
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Scorns to unsay what once it hath deliver'd.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: In that dead time when Gloucester's death was plotted,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: I heard you say, 'Is not my arm of length,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That reacheth from the restful English court
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: As far as Calais, to mine uncle's head?'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Amongst much other talk, that very time,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: I heard you say that you had rather refuse
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: The offer of an hundred thousand crowns
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Than Bolingbroke's return to England;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Adding withal how blest this land would be
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: In this your cousin's death.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Princes and noble lords,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: What answer shall I make to this base man?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Shall I so much dishonour my fair stars,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: On equal terms to give him chastisement?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Either I must, or have mine honour soil'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: With the attainder of his slanderous lips.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: There is my gage, the manual seal of death,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That marks thee out for hell: I say, thou liest,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And will maintain what thou hast said is false
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: In thy heart-blood, though being all too base
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To stain the temper of my knightly sword.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Bagot, forbear; thou shalt not take it up.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Excepting one, I would he were the best
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: In all this presence that hath moved me so.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: If that thy valour stand on sympathy,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: There is my gage, Aumerle, in gage to thine:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: By that fair sun which shows me where thou stand'st,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: I heard thee say, and vauntingly thou spakest it
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That thou wert cause of noble Gloucester's death.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: If thou deny'st it twenty times, thou liest;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And I will turn thy falsehood to thy heart,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Where it was forged, with my rapier's point.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Thou darest not, coward, live to see that day.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Now by my soul, I would it were this hour.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Fitzwater, thou art damn'd to hell for this.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Aumerle, thou liest; his honour is as true
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: In this appeal as thou art all unjust;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And that thou art so, there I throw my gage,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To prove it on thee to the extremest point
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Of mortal breathing: seize it, if thou darest.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: An if I do not, may my hands rot off
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And never brandish more revengeful steel
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Over the glittering helmet of my foe!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: I task the earth to the like, forsworn Aumerle;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And spur thee on with full as many lies
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: As may be holloa'd in thy treacherous ear
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: From sun to sun: there is my honour's pawn;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Engage it to the trial, if thou darest.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Who sets me else? by heaven, I'll throw at all:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: I have a thousand spirits in one breast,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To answer twenty thousand such as you.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: My Lord Fitzwater, I do remember well
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: The very time Aumerle and you did talk.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: 'Tis very true: you were in presence then;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And you can witness with me this is true.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: As false, by heaven, as heaven itself is true.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Surrey, thou liest.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Dishonourable boy!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That lie shall lie so heavy on my sword,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That it shall render vengeance and revenge
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Till thou the lie-giver and that lie do lie
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: In earth as quiet as thy father's skull:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: In proof whereof, there is my honour's pawn;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Engage it to the trial, if thou darest.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: How fondly dost thou spur a forward horse!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: If I dare eat, or drink, or breathe, or live,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: I dare meet Surrey in a wilderness,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And spit upon him, whilst I say he lies,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And lies, and lies: there is my bond of faith,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To tie thee to my strong correction.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: As I intend to thrive in this new world,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Aumerle is guilty of my true appeal:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Besides, I heard the banish'd Norfolk say
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That thou, Aumerle, didst send two of thy men
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To execute the noble duke at Calais.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Some honest Christian trust me with a gage
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That Norfolk lies: here do I throw down this,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: If he may be repeal'd, to try his honour.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: These differences shall all rest under gage
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Till Norfolk be repeal'd: repeal'd he shall be,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And, though mine enemy, restored again
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To all his lands and signories: when he's return'd,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Against Aumerle we will enforce his trial.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That honourable day shall ne'er be seen.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Many a time hath banish'd Norfolk fought
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: For Jesu Christ in glorious Christian field,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Streaming the ensign of the Christian cross
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Against black pagans, Turks, and Saracens:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And toil'd with works of war, retired himself
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To Italy; and there at Venice gave
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: His body to that pleasant country's earth,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And his pure soul unto his captain Christ,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Under whose colours he had fought so long.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Why, bishop, is Norfolk dead?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: As surely as I live, my lord.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Sweet peace conduct his sweet soul to the bosom
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Of good old Abraham! Lords appellants,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Your differences shall all rest under gage
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Till we assign you to your days of trial.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Great Duke of Lancaster, I come to thee
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: From plume-pluck'd Richard; who with willing soul
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Adopts thee heir, and his high sceptre yields
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To the possession of thy royal hand:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Ascend his throne, descending now from him;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And long live Henry, fourth of that name!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: In God's name, I'll ascend the regal throne.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Marry. God forbid!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Worst in this royal presence may I speak,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Yet best beseeming me to speak the truth.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Would God that any in this noble presence
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Were enough noble to be upright judge
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Of noble Richard! then true noblesse would
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Learn him forbearance from so foul a wrong.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: What subject can give sentence on his king?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And who sits here that is not Richard's subject?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Thieves are not judged but they are by to hear,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Although apparent guilt be seen in them;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And shall the figure of God's majesty,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: His captain, steward, deputy-elect,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Anointed, crowned, planted many years,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Be judged by subject and inferior breath,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And he himself not present? O, forfend it, God,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That in a Christian climate souls refined
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Should show so heinous, black, obscene a deed!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: I speak to subjects, and a subject speaks,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Stirr'd up by God, thus boldly for his king:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: My Lord of Hereford here, whom you call king,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Is a foul traitor to proud Hereford's king:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And if you crown him, let me prophesy:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: The blood of English shall manure the ground,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And future ages groan for this foul act;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Peace shall go sleep with Turks and infidels,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And in this seat of peace tumultuous wars
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Shall kin with kin and kind with kind confound;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Disorder, horror, fear and mutiny
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Shall here inhabit, and this land be call'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: The field of Golgotha and dead men's skulls.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: O, if you raise this house against this house,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: It will the woefullest division prove
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That ever fell upon this cursed earth.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Prevent it, resist it, let it not be so,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Lest child, child's children, cry against you woe!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Well have you argued, sir; and, for your pains,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Of capital treason we arrest you here.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: My Lord of Westminster, be it your charge
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To keep him safely till his day of trial.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: May it please you, lords, to grant the commons' suit.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Fetch hither Richard, that in common view
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: He may surrender; so we shall proceed
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Without suspicion.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: I will be his conduct.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Lords, you that here are under our arrest,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Procure your sureties for your days of answer.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Little are we beholding to your love,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And little look'd for at your helping hands.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Alack, why am I sent for to a king,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Before I have shook off the regal thoughts
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Wherewith I reign'd? I hardly yet have learn'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To insinuate, flatter, bow, and bend my limbs:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Give sorrow leave awhile to tutor me
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To this submission. Yet I well remember
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: The favours of these men: were they not mine?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Did they not sometime cry, 'all hail!' to me?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: So Judas did to Christ: but he, in twelve,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Found truth in all but one: I, in twelve thousand, none.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: God save the king! Will no man say amen?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Am I both priest and clerk? well then, amen.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: God save the king! although I be not he;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And yet, amen, if heaven do think him me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To do what service am I sent for hither?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To do that office of thine own good will
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Which tired majesty did make thee offer,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: The resignation of thy state and crown
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To Henry Bolingbroke.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Give me the crown. Here, cousin, seize the crown;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Here cousin:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: On this side my hand, and on that side yours.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Now is this golden crown like a deep well
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That owes two buckets, filling one another,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: The emptier ever dancing in the air,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: The other down, unseen and full of water:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That bucket down and full of tears am I,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Drinking my griefs, whilst you mount up on high.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: I thought you had been willing to resign.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: My crown I am; but still my griefs are mine:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: You may my glories and my state depose,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: But not my griefs; still am I king of those.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Part of your cares you give me with your crown.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Your cares set up do not pluck my cares down.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: My care is loss of care, by old care done;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Your care is gain of care, by new care won:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: The cares I give I have, though given away;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: They tend the crown, yet still with me they stay.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Are you contented to resign the crown?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Ay, no; no, ay; for I must nothing be;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Therefore no no, for I resign to thee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Now mark me, how I will undo myself;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: I give this heavy weight from off my head
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And this unwieldy sceptre from my hand,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: The pride of kingly sway from out my heart;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: With mine own tears I wash away my balm,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: With mine own hands I give away my crown,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: With mine own tongue deny my sacred state,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: With mine own breath release all duty's rites:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: All pomp and majesty I do forswear;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: My manors, rents, revenues I forego;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: My acts, decrees, and statutes I deny:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: God pardon all oaths that are broke to me!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: God keep all vows unbroke that swear to thee!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Make me, that nothing have, with nothing grieved,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And thou with all pleased, that hast all achieved!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Long mayst thou live in Richard's seat to sit,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And soon lie Richard in an earthly pit!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: God save King Harry, unking'd Richard says,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And send him many years of sunshine days!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: What more remains?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: No more, but that you read
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: These accusations and these grievous crimes
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Committed by your person and your followers
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Against the state and profit of this land;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That, by confessing them, the souls of men
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: May deem that you are worthily deposed.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Must I do so? and must I ravel out
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: My weaved-up folly? Gentle Northumberland,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: If thy offences were upon record,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Would it not shame thee in so fair a troop
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To read a lecture of them? If thou wouldst,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: There shouldst thou find one heinous article,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Containing the deposing of a king
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And cracking the strong warrant of an oath,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Mark'd with a blot, damn'd in the book of heaven:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Nay, all of you that stand and look upon,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Whilst that my wretchedness doth bait myself,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Though some of you with Pilate wash your hands
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Showing an outward pity; yet you Pilates
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Have here deliver'd me to my sour cross,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And water cannot wash away your sin.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: My lord, dispatch; read o'er these articles.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Mine eyes are full of tears, I cannot see:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And yet salt water blinds them not so much
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: But they can see a sort of traitors here.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Nay, if I turn mine eyes upon myself,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: I find myself a traitor with the rest;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: For I have given here my soul's consent
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To undeck the pompous body of a king;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Made glory base and sovereignty a slave,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Proud majesty a subject, state a peasant.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: My lord,--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: No lord of thine, thou haught insulting man,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Nor no man's lord; I have no name, no title,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: No, not that name was given me at the font,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: But 'tis usurp'd: alack the heavy day,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That I have worn so many winters out,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And know not now what name to call myself!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: O that I were a mockery king of snow,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Standing before the sun of Bolingbroke,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To melt myself away in water-drops!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Good king, great king, and yet not greatly good,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: An if my word be sterling yet in England,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Let it command a mirror hither straight,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That it may show me what a face I have,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Since it is bankrupt of his majesty.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Go some of you and fetch a looking-glass.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Read o'er this paper while the glass doth come.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Fiend, thou torment'st me ere I come to hell!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Urge it no more, my Lord Northumberland.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: The commons will not then be satisfied.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: They shall be satisfied: I'll read enough,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: When I do see the very book indeed
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Where all my sins are writ, and that's myself.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Give me the glass, and therein will I read.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: No deeper wrinkles yet? hath sorrow struck
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: So many blows upon this face of mine,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And made no deeper wounds? O flattering glass,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Like to my followers in prosperity,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Thou dost beguile me! Was this face the face
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That every day under his household roof
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Did keep ten thousand men? was this the face
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That, like the sun, did make beholders wink?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Was this the face that faced so many follies,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And was at last out-faced by Bolingbroke?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: A brittle glory shineth in this face:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: As brittle as the glory is the face;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: For there it is, crack'd in a hundred shivers.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Mark, silent king, the moral of this sport,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: How soon my sorrow hath destroy'd my face.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: The shadow of your sorrow hath destroy'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: The shadow or your face.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Say that again.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: The shadow of my sorrow! ha! let's see:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: 'Tis very true, my grief lies all within;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And these external manners of laments
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Are merely shadows to the unseen grief
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That swells with silence in the tortured soul;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: There lies the substance: and I thank thee, king,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.
