line_text: For thy great bounty, that not only givest
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Me cause to wail but teachest me the way
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: How to lament the cause. I'll beg one boon,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And then be gone and trouble you no more.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Shall I obtain it?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Name it, fair cousin.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: 'Fair cousin'? I am greater than a king:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: For when I was a king, my flatterers
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Were then but subjects; being now a subject,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: I have a king here to my flatterer.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Being so great, I have no need to beg.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Yet ask.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: And shall I have?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: You shall.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Then give me leave to go.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Whither?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Whither you will, so I were from your sights.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Go, some of you convey him to the Tower.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: O, good! convey? conveyers are you all,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: That rise thus nimbly by a true king's fall.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: On Wednesday next we solemnly set down
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Our coronation: lords, prepare yourselves.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: A woeful pageant have we here beheld.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: The woe's to come; the children yet unborn.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Shall feel this day as sharp to them as thorn.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: You holy clergymen, is there no plot
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To rid the realm of this pernicious blot?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: My lord,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Before I freely speak my mind herein,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: You shall not only take the sacrament
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: To bury mine intents, but also to effect
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Whatever I shall happen to devise.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: I see your brows are full of discontent,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Your hearts of sorrow and your eyes of tears:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: Come home with me to supper; and I'll lay
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: A plot shall show us all a merry day.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  Westminster Hall.

line_text: This way the king will come; this is the way
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: To Julius Caesar's ill-erected tower,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: To whose flint bosom my condemned lord
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Is doom'd a prisoner by proud Bolingbroke:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Here let us rest, if this rebellious earth
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Have any resting for her true king's queen.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: But soft, but see, or rather do not see,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: My fair rose wither: yet look up, behold,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: That you in pity may dissolve to dew,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: And wash him fresh again with true-love tears.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Ah, thou, the model where old Troy did stand,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Thou map of honour, thou King Richard's tomb,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: And not King Richard; thou most beauteous inn,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Why should hard-favour'd grief be lodged in thee,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: When triumph is become an alehouse guest?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Join not with grief, fair woman, do not so,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: To make my end too sudden: learn, good soul,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: To think our former state a happy dream;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: From which awaked, the truth of what we are
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Shows us but this: I am sworn brother, sweet,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: To grim Necessity, and he and I
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Will keep a league till death. Hie thee to France
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: And cloister thee in some religious house:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Our holy lives must win a new world's crown,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Which our profane hours here have stricken down.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: What, is my Richard both in shape and mind
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Transform'd and weaken'd? hath Bolingbroke deposed
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Thine intellect? hath he been in thy heart?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: The lion dying thrusteth forth his paw,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: And wounds the earth, if nothing else, with rage
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: To be o'erpower'd; and wilt thou, pupil-like,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Take thy correction mildly, kiss the rod,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: And fawn on rage with base humility,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Which art a lion and a king of beasts?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: A king of beasts, indeed; if aught but beasts,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: I had been still a happy king of men.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Good sometime queen, prepare thee hence for France:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Think I am dead and that even here thou takest,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: As from my death-bed, thy last living leave.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: In winter's tedious nights sit by the fire
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: With good old folks and let them tell thee tales
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Of woeful ages long ago betid;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: And ere thou bid good night, to quit their griefs,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Tell thou the lamentable tale of me
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: And send the hearers weeping to their beds:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: For why, the senseless brands will sympathize
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: The heavy accent of thy moving tongue
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: And in compassion weep the fire out;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: And some will mourn in ashes, some coal-black,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: For the deposing of a rightful king.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: My lord, the mind of Bolingbroke is changed:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: You must to Pomfret, not unto the Tower.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: And, madam, there is order ta'en for you;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: With all swift speed you must away to France.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Northumberland, thou ladder wherewithal
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: The mounting Bolingbroke ascends my throne,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: The time shall not be many hours of age
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: More than it is ere foul sin gathering head
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Shalt break into corruption: thou shalt think,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Though he divide the realm and give thee half,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: It is too little, helping him to all;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: And he shall think that thou, which know'st the way
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: To plant unrightful kings, wilt know again,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Being ne'er so little urged, another way
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: To pluck him headlong from the usurped throne.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: The love of wicked men converts to fear;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: That fear to hate, and hate turns one or both
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: To worthy danger and deserved death.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: My guilt be on my head, and there an end.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Take leave and part; for you must part forthwith.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Doubly divorced! Bad men, you violate
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: A twofold marriage, 'twixt my crown and me,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: And then betwixt me and my married wife.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Let me unkiss the oath 'twixt thee and me;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: And yet not so, for with a kiss 'twas made.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Part us, Northumberland; I toward the north,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Where shivering cold and sickness pines the clime;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: My wife to France: from whence, set forth in pomp,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: She came adorned hither like sweet May,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Sent back like Hallowmas or short'st of day.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: And must we be divided? must we part?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Ay, hand from hand, my love, and heart from heart.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Banish us both and send the king with me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: That were some love but little policy.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Then whither he goes, thither let me go.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: So two, together weeping, make one woe.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Weep thou for me in France, I for thee here;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Better far off than near, be ne'er the near.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Go, count thy way with sighs; I mine with groans.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: So longest way shall have the longest moans.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Twice for one step I'll groan, the way being short,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: And piece the way out with a heavy heart.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Come, come, in wooing sorrow let's be brief,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Since, wedding it, there is such length in grief;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: One kiss shall stop our mouths, and dumbly part;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Thus give I mine, and thus take I thy heart.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Give me mine own again; 'twere no good part
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: To take on me to keep and kill thy heart.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: So, now I have mine own again, be gone,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: That I might strive to kill it with a groan.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: We make woe wanton with this fond delay:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: Once more, adieu; the rest let sorrow say.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE I.  London. A street leading to the Tower.

line_text: My lord, you told me you would tell the rest,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: When weeping made you break the story off,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: of our two cousins coming into London.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Where did I leave?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: At that sad stop, my lord,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Where rude misgovern'd hands from windows' tops
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Threw dust and rubbish on King Richard's head.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Then, as I said, the duke, great Bolingbroke,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Mounted upon a hot and fiery steed
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Which his aspiring rider seem'd to know,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: With slow but stately pace kept on his course,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Whilst all tongues cried 'God save thee,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Bolingbroke!'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: You would have thought the very windows spake,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: So many greedy looks of young and old
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Through casements darted their desiring eyes
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Upon his visage, and that all the walls
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: With painted imagery had said at once
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: 'Jesu preserve thee! welcome, Bolingbroke!'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Whilst he, from the one side to the other turning,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Bareheaded, lower than his proud steed's neck,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Bespake them thus: 'I thank you, countrymen:'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: And thus still doing, thus he pass'd along.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Alack, poor Richard! where rode he the whilst?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: As in a theatre, the eyes of men,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: After a well-graced actor leaves the stage,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Are idly bent on him that enters next,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Thinking his prattle to be tedious;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Even so, or with much more contempt, men's eyes
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Did scowl on gentle Richard; no man cried 'God save him!'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: No joyful tongue gave him his welcome home:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: But dust was thrown upon his sacred head:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Which with such gentle sorrow he shook off,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: His face still combating with tears and smiles,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: The badges of his grief and patience,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: That had not God, for some strong purpose, steel'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: The hearts of men, they must perforce have melted
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: And barbarism itself have pitied him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: But heaven hath a hand in these events,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: To whose high will we bound our calm contents.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: To Bolingbroke are we sworn subjects now,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Whose state and honour I for aye allow.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Here comes my son Aumerle.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Aumerle that was;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: But that is lost for being Richard's friend,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: And, madam, you must call him Rutland now:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: I am in parliament pledge for his truth
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: And lasting fealty to the new-made king.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Welcome, my son: who are the violets now
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: That strew the green lap of the new come spring?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Madam, I know not, nor I greatly care not:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: God knows I had as lief be none as one.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Well, bear you well in this new spring of time,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Lest you be cropp'd before you come to prime.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: What news from Oxford? hold those justs and triumphs?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: For aught I know, my lord, they do.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: You will be there, I know.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: If God prevent not, I purpose so.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: What seal is that, that hangs without thy bosom?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Yea, look'st thou pale? let me see the writing.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: My lord, 'tis nothing.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: No matter, then, who see it;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: I will be satisfied; let me see the writing.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: I do beseech your grace to pardon me:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: It is a matter of small consequence,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Which for some reasons I would not have seen.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Which for some reasons, sir, I mean to see.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: I fear, I fear,--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: What should you fear?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: 'Tis nothing but some bond, that he is enter'd into
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: For gay apparel 'gainst the triumph day.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Bound to himself! what doth he with a bond
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: That he is bound to? Wife, thou art a fool.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Boy, let me see the writing.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: I do beseech you, pardon me; I may not show it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: I will be satisfied; let me see it, I say.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Treason! foul treason! Villain! traitor! slave!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: What is the matter, my lord?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Ho! who is within there?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Saddle my horse.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: God for his mercy, what treachery is here!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Why, what is it, my lord?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Give me my boots, I say; saddle my horse.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Now, by mine honour, by my life, by my troth,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: I will appeach the villain.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: What is the matter?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Peace, foolish woman.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: I will not peace. What is the matter, Aumerle.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Good mother, be content; it is no more
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Than my poor life must answer.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Thy life answer!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Bring me my boots: I will unto the king.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Strike him, Aumerle. Poor boy, thou art amazed.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Hence, villain! never more come in my sight.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Give me my boots, I say.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Why, York, what wilt thou do?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Wilt thou not hide the trespass of thine own?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Have we more sons? or are we like to have?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Is not my teeming date drunk up with time?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: And wilt thou pluck my fair son from mine age,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: And rob me of a happy mother's name?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Is he not like thee? is he not thine own?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Thou fond mad woman,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Wilt thou conceal this dark conspiracy?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: A dozen of them here have ta'en the sacrament,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: And interchangeably set down their hands,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: To kill the king at Oxford.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: He shall be none;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: We'll keep him here: then what is that to him?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Away, fond woman! were he twenty times my son,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: I would appeach him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Hadst thou groan'd for him
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: As I have done, thou wouldst be more pitiful.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: But now I know thy mind; thou dost suspect
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: That I have been disloyal to thy bed,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: And that he is a bastard, not thy son:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Sweet York, sweet husband, be not of that mind:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: He is as like thee as a man may be,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Not like to me, or any of my kin,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: And yet I love him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Make way, unruly woman!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: After, Aumerle! mount thee upon his horse;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Spur post, and get before him to the king,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: And beg thy pardon ere he do accuse thee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: I'll not be long behind; though I be old,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: I doubt not but to ride as fast as York:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: And never will I rise up from the ground
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Till Bolingbroke have pardon'd thee. Away, be gone!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE II.  The DUKE OF YORK's palace.

line_text: Can no man tell me of my unthrifty son?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: 'Tis full three months since I did see him last;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: If any plague hang over us, 'tis he.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: I would to God, my lords, he might be found:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Inquire at London, 'mongst the taverns there,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: For there, they say, he daily doth frequent,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: With unrestrained loose companions,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Even such, they say, as stand in narrow lanes,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: And beat our watch, and rob our passengers;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Which he, young wanton and effeminate boy,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Takes on the point of honour to support
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: So dissolute a crew.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: My lord, some two days since I saw the prince,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: And told him of those triumphs held at Oxford.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: And what said the gallant?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: His answer was, he would unto the stews,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: And from the common'st creature pluck a glove,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: And wear it as a favour; and with that
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: He would unhorse the lustiest challenger.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: As dissolute as desperate; yet through both
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: I see some sparks of better hope, which elder years
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: May happily bring forth. But who comes here?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Where is the king?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: What means our cousin, that he stares and looks
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: So wildly?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: God save your grace! I do beseech your majesty,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: To have some conference with your grace alone.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Withdraw yourselves, and leave us here alone.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: What is the matter with our cousin now?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: For ever may my knees grow to the earth,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: My tongue cleave to my roof within my mouth
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Unless a pardon ere I rise or speak.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Intended or committed was this fault?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: If on the first, how heinous e'er it be,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: To win thy after-love I pardon thee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Then give me leave that I may turn the key,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: That no man enter till my tale be done.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Have thy desire.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Thou hast a traitor in thy presence there.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Villain, I'll make thee safe.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Stay thy revengeful hand; thou hast no cause to fear.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Shall I for love speak treason to thy face?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Open the door, or I will break it open.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: What is the matter, uncle? speak;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Recover breath; tell us how near is danger,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: That we may arm us to encounter it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Peruse this writing here, and thou shalt know
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: The treason that my haste forbids me show.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Remember, as thou read'st, thy promise pass'd:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: I do repent me; read not my name there
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: My heart is not confederate with my hand.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: It was, villain, ere thy hand did set it down.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: I tore it from the traitor's bosom, king;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Fear, and not love, begets his penitence:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Forget to pity him, lest thy pity prove
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: A serpent that will sting thee to the heart.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: O heinous, strong and bold conspiracy!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: O loyal father of a treacherous son!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Thou sheer, immaculate and silver fountain,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: From when this stream through muddy passages
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Hath held his current and defiled himself!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Thy overflow of good converts to bad,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: And thy abundant goodness shall excuse
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: This deadly blot in thy digressing son.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: So shall my virtue be his vice's bawd;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: And he shall spend mine honour with his shame,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: As thriftless sons their scraping fathers' gold.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Mine honour lives when his dishonour dies,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Or my shamed life in his dishonour lies:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Thou kill'st me in his life; giving him breath,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: The traitor lives, the true man's put to death.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: let me in.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: What shrill-voiced suppliant makes this eager cry?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: A woman, and thy aunt, great king; 'tis I.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Speak with me, pity me, open the door.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: A beggar begs that never begg'd before.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Our scene is alter'd from a serious thing,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: And now changed to 'The Beggar and the King.'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: My dangerous cousin, let your mother in:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: I know she is come to pray for your foul sin.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: If thou do pardon, whosoever pray,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: More sins for this forgiveness prosper may.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: This fester'd joint cut off, the rest rest sound;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: This let alone will all the rest confound.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: O king, believe not this hard-hearted man!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Love loving not itself none other can.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Thou frantic woman, what dost thou make here?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Shall thy old dugs once more a traitor rear?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Sweet York, be patient. Hear me, gentle liege.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Rise up, good aunt.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Not yet, I thee beseech:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: For ever will I walk upon my knees,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: And never see day that the happy sees,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Till thou give joy; until thou bid me joy,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: By pardoning Rutland, my transgressing boy.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Unto my mother's prayers I bend my knee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Against them both my true joints bended be.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Ill mayst thou thrive, if thou grant any grace!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Pleads he in earnest? look upon his face;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: His eyes do drop no tears, his prayers are in jest;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: His words come from his mouth, ours from our breast:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: He prays but faintly and would be denied;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: We pray with heart and soul and all beside:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: His weary joints would gladly rise, I know;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Our knees shall kneel till to the ground they grow:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: His prayers are full of false hypocrisy;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Ours of true zeal and deep integrity.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Our prayers do out-pray his; then let them have
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: That mercy which true prayer ought to have.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Good aunt, stand up.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Nay, do not say, 'stand up;'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Say, 'pardon' first, and afterwards 'stand up.'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: And if I were thy nurse, thy tongue to teach,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: 'Pardon' should be the first word of thy speech.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: I never long'd to hear a word till now;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Say 'pardon,' king; let pity teach thee how:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: The word is short, but not so short as sweet;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: No word like 'pardon' for kings' mouths so meet.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Speak it in French, king; say, 'pardonne moi.'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Dost thou teach pardon pardon to destroy?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Ah, my sour husband, my hard-hearted lord,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: That set'st the word itself against the word!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Speak 'pardon' as 'tis current in our land;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: The chopping French we do not understand.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Thine eye begins to speak; set thy tongue there;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Or in thy piteous heart plant thou thine ear;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: That hearing how our plaints and prayers do pierce,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Pity may move thee 'pardon' to rehearse.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Good aunt, stand up.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: I do not sue to stand;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Pardon is all the suit I have in hand.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: I pardon him, as God shall pardon me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: O happy vantage of a kneeling knee!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Yet am I sick for fear: speak it again;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Twice saying 'pardon' doth not pardon twain,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: But makes one pardon strong.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: With all my heart
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: I pardon him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: A god on earth thou art.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: But for our trusty brother-in-law and the abbot,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: With all the rest of that consorted crew,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Destruction straight shall dog them at the heels.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Good uncle, help to order several powers
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: To Oxford, or where'er these traitors are:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: They shall not live within this world, I swear,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: But I will have them, if I once know where.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Uncle, farewell: and, cousin too, adieu:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Your mother well hath pray'd, and prove you true.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Come, my old son: I pray God make thee new.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE III.  A royal palace.

line_text: Didst thou not mark the king, what words he spake,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The same.

line_text: 'Have I no friend will rid me of this living fear?'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The same.

line_text: Was it not so?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The same.

line_text: These were his very words.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The same.

line_text: 'Have I no friend?' quoth he: he spake it twice,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The same.

line_text: And urged it twice together, did he not?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The same.

line_text: He did.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The same.

line_text: And speaking it, he wistly look'd on me,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The same.

line_text: And who should say, 'I would thou wert the man'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The same.

line_text: That would divorce this terror from my heart;'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The same.

line_text: Meaning the king at Pomfret. Come, let's go:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The same.

line_text: I am the king's friend, and will rid his foe.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE IV.  The same.

line_text: I have been studying how I may compare
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: This prison where I live unto the world:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: And for because the world is populous
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: And here is not a creature but myself,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: I cannot do it; yet I'll hammer it out.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: My brain I'll prove the female to my soul,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: My soul the father; and these two beget
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: A generation of still-breeding thoughts,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: And these same thoughts people this little world,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: In humours like the people of this world,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: For no thought is contented. The better sort,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: As thoughts of things divine, are intermix'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: With scruples and do set the word itself
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Against the word:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: As thus, 'Come, little ones,' and then again,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: 'It is as hard to come as for a camel
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: To thread the postern of a small needle's eye.'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Thoughts tending to ambition, they do plot
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Unlikely wonders; how these vain weak nails
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: May tear a passage through the flinty ribs
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Of this hard world, my ragged prison walls,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: And, for they cannot, die in their own pride.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Thoughts tending to content flatter themselves
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: That they are not the first of fortune's slaves,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Nor shall not be the last; like silly beggars
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Who sitting in the stocks refuge their shame,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: That many have and others must sit there;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: And in this thought they find a kind of ease,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Bearing their own misfortunes on the back
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Of such as have before endured the like.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Thus play I in one person many people,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: And none contented: sometimes am I king;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Then treasons make me wish myself a beggar,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: And so I am: then crushing penury
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Persuades me I was better when a king;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Then am I king'd again: and by and by
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Think that I am unking'd by Bolingbroke,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: And straight am nothing: but whate'er I be,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Nor I nor any man that but man is
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: With nothing shall be pleased, till he be eased
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: With being nothing. Music do I hear?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Ha, ha! keep time: how sour sweet music is,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: When time is broke and no proportion kept!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: So is it in the music of men's lives.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: And here have I the daintiness of ear
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: To cheque time broke in a disorder'd string;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: But for the concord of my state and time
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Had not an ear to hear my true time broke.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: I wasted time, and now doth time waste me;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: For now hath time made me his numbering clock:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: My thoughts are minutes; and with sighs they jar
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Their watches on unto mine eyes, the outward watch,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Whereto my finger, like a dial's point,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Is pointing still, in cleansing them from tears.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Now sir, the sound that tells what hour it is
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Are clamorous groans, which strike upon my heart,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Which is the bell: so sighs and tears and groans
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Show minutes, times, and hours: but my time
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Runs posting on in Bolingbroke's proud joy,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: While I stand fooling here, his Jack o' the clock.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: This music mads me; let it sound no more;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: For though it have holp madmen to their wits,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: In me it seems it will make wise men mad.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Yet blessing on his heart that gives it me!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: For 'tis a sign of love; and love to Richard
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Is a strange brooch in this all-hating world.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Hail, royal prince!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Thanks, noble peer;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: The cheapest of us is ten groats too dear.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: What art thou? and how comest thou hither,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Where no man never comes but that sad dog
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: That brings me food to make misfortune live?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: I was a poor groom of thy stable, king,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: When thou wert king; who, travelling towards York,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: With much ado at length have gotten leave
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: To look upon my sometimes royal master's face.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: O, how it yearn'd my heart when I beheld
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: In London streets, that coronation-day,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: When Bolingbroke rode on roan Barbary,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: That horse that thou so often hast bestrid,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: That horse that I so carefully have dress'd!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Rode he on Barbary? Tell me, gentle friend,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: How went he under him?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: So proudly as if he disdain'd the ground.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
