scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: So proud that Bolingbroke was on his back!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: That jade hath eat bread from my royal hand;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: This hand hath made him proud with clapping him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Would he not stumble? would he not fall down,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Since pride must have a fall, and break the neck
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Of that proud man that did usurp his back?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Forgiveness, horse! why do I rail on thee,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Since thou, created to be awed by man,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Wast born to bear? I was not made a horse;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: And yet I bear a burthen like an ass,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Spurr'd, gall'd and tired by jouncing Bolingbroke.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Fellow, give place; here is no longer stay.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: If thou love me, 'tis time thou wert away.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: What my tongue dares not, that my heart shall say.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: My lord, will't please you to fall to?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Taste of it first, as thou art wont to do.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: My lord, I dare not: Sir Pierce of Exton, who
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: lately came from the king, commands the contrary.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: The devil take Henry of Lancaster and thee!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Patience is stale, and I am weary of it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Help, help, help!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: How now! what means death in this rude assault?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Villain, thy own hand yields thy death's instrument.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Go thou, and fill another room in hell.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: That hand shall burn in never-quenching fire
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: That staggers thus my person. Exton, thy fierce hand
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Hath with the king's blood stain'd the king's own land.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Mount, mount, my soul! thy seat is up on high;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Whilst my gross flesh sinks downward, here to die.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: As full of valour as of royal blood:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Both have I spill'd; O would the deed were good!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: For now the devil, that told me I did well,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Says that this deed is chronicled in hell.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: This dead king to the living king I'll bear
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Take hence the rest, and give them burial here.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE V.  Pomfret castle.

line_text: Kind uncle York, the latest news we hear
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: Is that the rebels have consumed with fire
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: Our town of Cicester in Gloucestershire;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: But whether they be ta'en or slain we hear not.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: Welcome, my lord what is the news?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: First, to thy sacred state wish I all happiness.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: The next news is, I have to London sent
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: The heads of Oxford, Salisbury, Blunt, and Kent:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: The manner of their taking may appear
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: At large discoursed in this paper here.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: We thank thee, gentle Percy, for thy pains;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: And to thy worth will add right worthy gains.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: My lord, I have from Oxford sent to London
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: The heads of Brocas and Sir Bennet Seely,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: Two of the dangerous consorted traitors
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: That sought at Oxford thy dire overthrow.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: Thy pains, Fitzwater, shall not be forgot;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: Right noble is thy merit, well I wot.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: The grand conspirator, Abbot of Westminster,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: With clog of conscience and sour melancholy
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: Hath yielded up his body to the grave;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: But here is Carlisle living, to abide
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: Thy kingly doom and sentence of his pride.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: Carlisle, this is your doom:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: Choose out some secret place, some reverend room,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: More than thou hast, and with it joy thy life;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: So as thou livest in peace, die free from strife:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: For though mine enemy thou hast ever been,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: High sparks of honour in thee have I seen.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: Great king, within this coffin I present
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: Thy buried fear: herein all breathless lies
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: The mightiest of thy greatest enemies,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: Richard of Bordeaux, by me hither brought.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: Exton, I thank thee not; for thou hast wrought
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: A deed of slander with thy fatal hand
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: Upon my head and all this famous land.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: From your own mouth, my lord, did I this deed.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: They love not poison that do poison need,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: Nor do I thee: though I did wish him dead,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: I hate the murderer, love him murdered.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: The guilt of conscience take thou for thy labour,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: But neither my good word nor princely favour:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: With Cain go wander through shades of night,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: And never show thy head by day nor light.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: Lords, I protest, my soul is full of woe,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: That blood should sprinkle me to make me grow:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: Come, mourn with me for that I do lament,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: And put on sullen black incontinent:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: I'll make a voyage to the Holy Land,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: To wash this blood off from my guilty hand:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: March sadly after; grace my mournings here;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.

line_text: In weeping after this untimely bier.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of King Richard the Second
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Windsor castle.
